ProviderLocation: 140 E 41st St , New York City , NY 10017 140 E 41st St , New York City, NY 10017
ReviewText: We booked this because it was reasonably close to our hotel, and if we weren't exhausted we probably would have left as soon as we walked in and heard the music. It was comically loud - but they had our table waiting so we thought we'd make the best of it and just duck under the table if we had to talk. Surprisingly for the food was really good - my husband had the short rib French dip, and I had the turkey burger. The sweet potato fries were good. And the beer list is good as well. If it weren't for the music, I'd go back. But I somehow suspect the music is supposed to keep adult couples like us away!
ReviewTitle: Incredibly LOUD music, but pretty good food

ProviderLocation: 140 E 41st St , New York City , NY 10017 140 E 41st St , New York City, NY 10017
ReviewText: This pub was recommended to us by our bellman. The drinks were good with excellent service from the bar staff. The bar was very crowded and extremely noisy so if you want a quiet place to have some drinks, this is not the place for you.

ProviderLocation: 140 E 41st St , New York City , NY 10017 140 E 41st St , New York City, NY 10017
ReviewText: We used this pub/bar as our "go to" local for the 5 days we were in NY.we were only staying around the corner so this was perfect place not too far in the cold night air. They have an happy hour from 4-7 which is when the place starts getting busy. $10 dollars for a draught beer plus a vodka mixer. There is most sports shown on several huge screens,the staff are quite good and there is a seperate bar and restuarant area. We ate here one night and the food was ok but not fantastic. We enjoyed the way the place felt plus the happy hours are decent value.Which is why we kept going back.
ReviewTitle: TRUE REVIEW OF - THE PUBLIC HOUSE

ProviderLocation: 140 E 41st St , New York City , NY 10017 140 E 41st St , New York City, NY 10017
ReviewText: Stopped here for lunch on our last day before catching our coach to the airport. The staff were brilliant, even storing our luggage for us in a secure room. We had a light meal and thought the food was very good - generous portions and very nicely presented? We had a very pleasant afternoon and the barman even bought us a drink!

ProviderLocation: 140 E 41st St , New York City , NY 10017 140 E 41st St , New York City, NY 10017
ReviewText: Visited here one afternoon and had an enjoyable experience. There was around only 15 people in the bar and the service was good. Stayed around 2 hours before leaving as they do shut at 17.00 until 20.00 (or at least they did that night) no complaints, very nice place inside.

ProviderLocation: 603 2nd Ave , at 33rd st , New York City , NY 10016-4858 603 2nd Ave , at 33rd st , New York City, NY 10016-4858
ReviewText: I am not a breakfast of brunch person but my wife and I had to get out early for a business visit. Our CPA had told us he finds Benjamin a nice family place, reasonable and friendly. I believe they at one time were affiliated with Mumbles one of since closed Gramercy staples. Our accountant was correct. It is nothing special but served the purpose for a quick and good brunch. I rarely skip the wine but as it was early just opted for coffee along with a very good salmon benedict. My wife had a large three egg omelet and fries. They prepared the egg on the benedict perfectly along with a large portion of Nova Salmon It has been on the corner of 33rd and Second for many years and will surely be around for the near future as there is a need for simple restaurants in this area of escalating prices.

ProviderLocation: 603 2nd Ave , at 33rd st , New York City , NY 10016-4858 603 2nd Ave , at 33rd st , New York City, NY 10016-4858
ReviewText: Looking to save money while vacationing in NYC I found this Groupon for 2 glasses of wine, appetizer to share and 2 entrees for $39. Made 6pm reservations on a Monday night, which the Groupon required. Good thing since the place filled up shortly after we arrived. Received bread basket which contained a very delicious cornbread. Had the Sesame Tuna as the App. Was prepared perfectly! Wasabi sauce was liquified wasabi so be warned. Didn't bother us as we both loved wasabi, but was deceiving as a sauce. I ordered the trout which was tasty and cooked just right. Husband had the rack of lamb which he described as savory, well prepared, and tasty. The only red wine that was an option for the groupon was a house cabernet, not the best. Service was great as well. Not disappointed which can often happen when using a Groupon to try a new restaurant.

ProviderLocation: 603 2nd Ave , at 33rd st , New York City , NY 10016-4858 603 2nd Ave , at 33rd st , New York City, NY 10016-4858
ReviewText: I got my Groupon on last week at Benjamin Restaurant & Bar. Great trout, broccoli, and Brussel sprouts! The two Pinot Grigios were good too. I have a ton of food allergies so they were able to accommodate me. I said Gracias to the kitchen staff. The waitstaff was great too.
ReviewTitle: Great trout, broccoli, and Brussel sprouts!

ProviderLocation: 603 2nd Ave , at 33rd st , New York City , NY 10016-4858 603 2nd Ave , at 33rd st , New York City, NY 10016-4858
ReviewText: Revisited this restaurant and wondered why we did not come here for often. It's a neighborhood gem. Atmosphere was nice and the noise level is decent. Service was excellent. Food was good; delicious and the portions were big for NYC standard. Pricing was very reasonable.

ProviderLocation: 603 2nd Ave , at 33rd st , New York City , NY 10016-4858 603 2nd Ave , at 33rd st , New York City, NY 10016-4858
ReviewText: Found this restaurant via livingsocial.com. We had a delicious 4 course meal. the Matzo Ball soup was the greatest we had in a long time. The rest of the meal fabulous. The waitress was very kind and helpfull. A real must Do when you are in NY

ProviderLocation: 603 2nd Ave , at 33rd st , New York City , NY 10016-4858 603 2nd Ave , at 33rd st , New York City, NY 10016-4858
ReviewText: I had lunch today for the first time at the Benjamin Restaurant and Bar. With an unassuming name, it is really a high-quality bistro. It surpassed my expectations, food wise, and service wise. The tomato soup was excellent. The kind, professional waitress offered me a taste of the carrot-ginger soup as well, and I tried it and loved it. I had flounder over a risotto with vegetables. Wonderful!

ProviderLocation: 603 2nd Ave , at 33rd st , New York City , NY 10016-4858 603 2nd Ave , at 33rd st , New York City, NY 10016-4858
ReviewText: They have the best cottage fries and burgers. It is an old bank vault that has an enormous ceiling. The service is quite good and the salads;especialy the crab is very good. I usually get the burgers rare with red onion.
ReviewTitle: Top Notch burgers and cottage fries

ProviderLocation: 325 W 57th St , Between 8th and 9th Ave , New York City , NY 10019-3105 325 W 57th St , Between 8th and 9th Ave , New York City, NY 10019-3105
ReviewText: I haven't been to a ton of Turkish restaurants, so I don't consider myself an expert in the cuisine, although I like it a lot. Fairly pricey, but the food is tasty and has lots of options. I'd go again, although I'd also look for cheaper places.

ProviderLocation: 325 W 57th St , Between 8th and 9th Ave , New York City , NY 10019-3105 325 W 57th St , Between 8th and 9th Ave , New York City, NY 10019-3105
ReviewText: We needed a quick dinner before a concert and ABA really fit our needs. The have a before 7pm deal with an app, entree and dessert for about $25 - a steal! The eggplant salad was smoky and delicious, the hummus tasty and smooth. Both are served with a crispy bread - better than pita. My husband liked his gyro plate but my ground lamb kebab plate was much better. It was juicy and nicely spiced. They are both served with a rice pilaf and some salad with a grilled tomato. Servings were large. Dessert was a choice of a couple of puddings. Both the chocolate and rice puddings were very commercial tasting. Everyone at the restaurant were terrific - attentive and friendly. The place is basic but comfortable enough. I would go back.

ProviderLocation: 325 W 57th St , Between 8th and 9th Ave , New York City , NY 10019-3105 325 W 57th St , Between 8th and 9th Ave , New York City, NY 10019-3105
ReviewText: Delicious cold appetizer plate served with fresh sesame breads and olive oil . The cubed lamb kebab was fork tender and seasoned just right . We should have BYOB due to no license for alcohol . Nevertheless a return spot for me .

ProviderLocation: 325 W 57th St , Between 8th and 9th Ave , New York City , NY 10019-3105 325 W 57th St , Between 8th and 9th Ave , New York City, NY 10019-3105
ReviewText: We noticed Aba on a walk and decided to give it a try. We enjoyed our lunch very much. It is casual and appears to cater to locals. They served a number of take away meals while we were there. We will be back and try other entrees.

ProviderLocation: 325 W 57th St , Between 8th and 9th Ave , New York City , NY 10019-3105 325 W 57th St , Between 8th and 9th Ave , New York City, NY 10019-3105
ReviewText: This is a small Byob that's delicious and not crazy expensive especially by NYC standards. The lamb shank special was perfect and the lamb kebobs exceptional. Lentil soup was very tasty and the baklava was yummy. No decaf coffee but decaf tea and regular coffee and Turkish coffee.

ProviderLocation: 325 W 57th St , Between 8th and 9th Ave , New York City , NY 10019-3105 325 W 57th St , Between 8th and 9th Ave , New York City, NY 10019-3105
ReviewText: Always a sucker for hot Turkish bread and homemade hummus!! Anything else doesn't matter....however the lamb kebabs and the baklava with pistachios were also winners!! You get what you hope for, and a little bit more at Aba.
ReviewTitle: ALittle Piece of Istanbul in NYC!!

ProviderLocation: 325 W 57th St , Between 8th and 9th Ave , New York City , NY 10019-3105 325 W 57th St , Between 8th and 9th Ave , New York City, NY 10019-3105
ReviewText: I went to Aba because my stomach was grumbling at 9:45PM. When I got there the restaurant was getting ready to close, but they still accommodated me! Very friendly server. Great complimentary appetizer (bread and oil) and entree! I did not have time to order dessert because I realized I was the last man sitting in the restaurant! I rushed things. Otherwise, it was a great experience!

ProviderLocation: 325 W 57th St , Between 8th and 9th Ave , New York City , NY 10019-3105 325 W 57th St , Between 8th and 9th Ave , New York City, NY 10019-3105
ReviewText: If you love whole fish as much as I do then you need to get yourself to Aba. The fish is fresh, served with a perfectly dressed salad and red cabbage slaw for under $25. So awesome.

ProviderLocation: 325 W 57th St , Between 8th and 9th Ave , New York City , NY 10019-3105 325 W 57th St , Between 8th and 9th Ave , New York City, NY 10019-3105
ReviewText: I started off with the Mucver which is pan fried zucchini pancakes (a mixture of zucchini, dill, parsley, eggs and flour) for $7.95. The pancakes did not have much flavor, only when they were dipped into an accompanying yogurt mixture did they have a decent amount of flavor. If I just wanted a yogurt flavored appetizer I would have ordered just yogurt and not the pancakes. My main course was lamb shank ($24.95) which is available occasionally but not listed on the menu, I just requested it, there were no specials of the day stated to me. It was tender and was topped with a slice of zucchini. It was okay, and was not among the most flavorful lamb shanks that I have ever had. For the price charged, it definitely should have been more flavorful. The service was good.

ProviderLocation: 325 W 57th St , Between 8th and 9th Ave , New York City , NY 10019-3105 325 W 57th St , Between 8th and 9th Ave , New York City, NY 10019-3105
ReviewText: If you miss ABA your missing a homely, friendly and utterly engaging eating experience in NY city. The menu offers a wide range of starters and mains.. My chicken and rice dish hit the spot as well as sending my taste buds into orbit. The 'after flavours'. linger on the palate. Everyone is attentive and they leave you to sit and sip Turkish Black tea. No rush.

ProviderLocation: 447 3rd Avenue , between E. 30th and E. 31 Street , New York City , NY 10016 447 3rd Avenue , between E. 30th and E. 31 Street , New York City, NY 10016
ReviewText: I give this restaurant 3 1/2 stars. The Dining area had a decent amount of space between tables and was nicely quiet at 6 when we entered. However, by 7:30, when we left, the room had filled up enough to be pretty noisy. Our appetizer was great - tender pieces of octopus plus browned onions and tiny bits of other food. The main meal itself was so-so. The chicken was so-so, as was my husband's mousaka. The waitstaff were excellent some of the time. They took turns walking past the tables as if checking to see if anyone needed anything; however, they rarely made eye contact on those rounds.
ReviewTitle: Best Octopus I've Had, but other Dishes "eh".

ProviderLocation: 10th Avenue , New York City , NY 10036 10th Avenue , New York City, NY 10036
ReviewText: My husband and I ate dinner there on Saturday night. The restaurant was full and yet we felt very well cared for! We ordered off the small plates menu and each one was better than the next! The octopus was the best we've ever had! It was such a great dinner and I can't wait to get back to New York to visit again!
ReviewTitle: One of the best meals in NYC!

ProviderLocation: 10th Avenue , New York City , NY 10036 10th Avenue , New York City, NY 10036
ReviewText: We had tickets for an off broadway show at the Pearl theater. Found it on open table. It is not a well decorated place but it did offer a warm feel when we entered. Our server was outstanding and knew just the rite times to show up to take our orders , fill water glass etc. the small plates were more than enough food and were plated nicely and full flavored. We will be back.
ReviewTitle: Finally a good place to eat in this area

ProviderLocation: 10th Avenue , New York City , NY 10036 10th Avenue , New York City, NY 10036
ReviewText: Small restaurant , excellent food , the humus was awesome . Good for family , nice bar . Near yotel hotel . Nice personnel.

ProviderLocation: 10th Avenue , New York City , NY 10036 10th Avenue , New York City, NY 10036
ReviewText: We walked by this restaurant on our way to an afternoon play and it looked lovely. We returned for an early dinner and the food and service was excellent.

ProviderLocation: 10th Avenue , New York City , NY 10036 10th Avenue , New York City, NY 10036
ReviewText: We were relaxing in the neighbourhood and we were captivated by the appearance of Meme, the menu & specials looked great as well as the fact the place was bustling... We went for the Merguez Sausage starter, followed by chicken kebabs, simple options but well presented, well seasoned and absolutely delicious!! The Chicken Schwarma special had sold out so will call ahead next time in NYC to request it... Service was spot on too, keep it up guys!!

ProviderLocation: 10th Avenue , New York City , NY 10036 10th Avenue , New York City, NY 10036
ReviewText: The foie gras on brioche toast is a must do! So many inviting plates on the menu, it's hard to stay sane. Coming back again.

ProviderLocation: 10th Avenue , New York City , NY 10036 10th Avenue , New York City, NY 10036
ReviewText: My wife and I recently visited this restaurant and found it to be just great food service and atmosphere highly recommend it.

ProviderLocation: 10th Avenue , New York City , NY 10036 10th Avenue , New York City, NY 10036
ReviewText: we had 4 "small plates' between the two of us. salad, foire gras , mushrooms with spinach, and chicken tacos. then the choc. lava cake for dessert. everything was excellent. We had read about the manager in previous writings , but found him to be exceptionally pleasant.

ProviderLocation: 10th Avenue , New York City , NY 10036 10th Avenue , New York City, NY 10036
ReviewText: Tuesday , September 27,2016 at approximately 2:10pm, I entered the Meme Mediterranean restaurant, Hell's Kitchen location, sat at the bar and intended to order food for lunch. Two male, and one female server walked pass me several times, looked me directly in the face, quickly shifted their glances, and did not greet me, nor ask me if I wanted to purchase a drink, or if even I was interested in seeing a menu. Mean while, as I patiently waited to be served, I observed three woman, who appeared to be of European decent, walk into the establishment, immediately one of the servers greeted the women, and informed them that, they would be able to serve them shortly. After sitting at said bar for 10 or more minutes continuing to behave in a civil manner, I asked a gentleman, (who I later discovered is the establishments owner/ manager) who I did not notice earlier while waiting to be serviced, "is anyone working at the bar?" ,his response was, "yes" and he stated, "oh I thought you ordered already. Upon receiving my order, I respectfully asked for the check and did not touch a single item of food. Said manager expressed concern about my decision not to eat, and he encouraged me to rethink my choice and stay instead. My decision however was final, and said manager decided not to charge me for the service. Once our social exchange was complete I left the area without further incident. We are in the year 2016 and it is unfortunate some people still prescribe to the ignorance perpetuated in Americas past. I refuse to support prejudice and empty-headedness, which in my humble opinion was the behavior displayed by these misinformed individuals.

ProviderLocation: 10th Avenue , New York City , NY 10036 10th Avenue , New York City, NY 10036
ReviewText: I am from syria originally, so I know what a tasty Mediterranean food taste like. I found this restaurant by coincidence. The offer complementary olives and olive oil amd bread which taste perfect as there is some garlic in the plate. I ordered sea food grill which is a smapler of salmon, scallop and shrimps. I will recommend this place.. Just order water as drink to enjoy the taste :)

ProviderLocation: 717 5th Ave , Frnt A , New York City , NY 10022-8120 717 5th Ave , Frnt A , New York City, NY 10022-8120
ReviewText: Every winter, my wife and I spend a couple of days in the City, staying on Central Park South, wandering the crowds in the stores, and celebrating the City. We are now living in the Southeast, working (for the first time in years) away from NYC. This year, we decided to try Armani's, as it is highly recommended, and close to our Hotel. We were greeted at the reception area and led through the spacious dining area to our table overlooking Fifth Ave and 57th. We had some prosecco while we ordered, and I enjoyed the spirited discussion as we chose the appropriate wine. I held out for a 2010 Brunello to go with the meal, and while the wine list is not overwhelming, there were a few reasonably priced jewels to choose from. One of the specials that evening was seasonally available white truffle risotto, and I have to say that it was completely out of this world. Our entrees were attractively presented, and we enjoyed some cognac and gelato to finish. The server brought the cognac in snifters tilted in warm water baths...an elegant extra touch. Slow food experience.. no hassles, no pressure, and an incredible ambience. We will definitely return, as experiences like that are meant to be lifetime memories, and I could use a few more memories like that.
ReviewTitle: Pleasant surprise. A treat for the senses, all around

ProviderLocation: 717 5th Ave , Frnt A , New York City , NY 10022-8120 717 5th Ave , Frnt A , New York City, NY 10022-8120
ReviewText: Spouse chose this for lunch on the first day of our visit as you can enter just before the security checkpoint for President-elect Trump. No protesters during our visit. It in on an upper floor and overlooks 5th Ave. But it is very expensive, definitely fine dining. Don't be in a rush, expect large portions, or reasonable pricing.

ProviderLocation: 717 5th Ave , Frnt A , New York City , NY 10022-8120 717 5th Ave , Frnt A , New York City, NY 10022-8120
ReviewText: My wife and I came here the night after the fiasco at trump. What a great experience. The food was excellent, the service top notch and the ambience very romantic. Given our awful experience at that mess of Trump's this was very redeeming.

ProviderLocation: 717 5th Ave , Frnt A , New York City , NY 10022-8120 717 5th Ave , Frnt A , New York City, NY 10022-8120
ReviewText: Nestled right in the heart of Midtown, this resturant is infused with the Armani clothing store, great idea!!! The staircase is a must-see beautiful.. So we stared with Armain martinis, very good, then for appetizers We had the octopus and also prosciutto ... The prosciutto was a little salty over cured .. For my entrée I had shrimp and pasta with truffles which was delicious.. It was a little noisy in there but the service was on point Irecommend going back for anyone!

ProviderLocation: 717 5th Ave , Frnt A , New York City , NY 10022-8120 717 5th Ave , Frnt A , New York City, NY 10022-8120
ReviewText: Popped in for a pizza the waiter was very helpful and recommended which pizza to order we had the house special and a meaty one we ordered large it was the biggest pizza I've ever seen they were about $20 each or there about there was enough food for about ten people it was delicious would visit again

ProviderLocation: 717 5th Ave , Frnt A , New York City , NY 10022-8120 717 5th Ave , Frnt A , New York City, NY 10022-8120
ReviewText: I just wanted a quiet lunch with excellent food. This restaurant did not disappoint. The Branzino was excellent. Do not go if you are really hungry as the portion was small. They also served four small confections at no additional price and and a very nice bread basket. Just off Fifth Avenue and a peaceful, elegant retreat.

ProviderLocation: 717 5th Ave , Frnt A , New York City , NY 10022-8120 717 5th Ave , Frnt A , New York City, NY 10022-8120
ReviewText: I was in NYC on business and for one evening only. Selected this place because it was nearby and the concept and brand name made me too lazy to walk or Uber further. Menu and food mediocre; service indifferent.

ProviderLocation: 717 5th Ave , Frnt A , New York City , NY 10022-8120 717 5th Ave , Frnt A , New York City, NY 10022-8120
ReviewText: Restaurant is gorgeous, classy, low key and high end. Ok, so you can't afford an Armani suit, but lunch you can afford. there is prix fixe but I opted for the a la carte menu and had the best la sagna east of the Continent. No pasta, but thin eggplant slices instead. A winner. I'll be back for another lunch soon and try something different. Stay tuned.
ReviewTitle: Great restaurant/ Who knew? it's in the Armani store on 5th

ProviderLocation: 2737 Broadway , Frnt A , New York City , NY 10027-4123 2737 Broadway , Frnt A , New York City, NY 10027-4123
ReviewText: Burger was great...special savory crepes were huge (and super-filling). Great value for the quality of food. Staff was fabulous! Never rushed but attentive. Great atmosphere with a good mix of (mostly) locals and tourists...just what we were looking for after a visit to Grant's Tomb.

ProviderLocation: 2737 Broadway , Frnt A , New York City , NY 10027-4123 2737 Broadway , Frnt A , New York City, NY 10027-4123
ReviewText: I don't believe that this place is bad all the time, but my wife and I went there and didn't leave happy. Our waiter was really rude and that kind of ruined our experience there. We may revisit at some point because the food wasn't bad.

ProviderLocation: 2737 Broadway , Frnt A , New York City , NY 10027-4123 2737 Broadway , Frnt A , New York City, NY 10027-4123
ReviewText: We went here on a sunny day after heading to Henry's for lunch. On arrival Henry's did not have the outside seating in place so we gravitated to toast. Result, we may never go to Henry's again. Good service complimented with excellent food and drink.

ProviderLocation: 2737 Broadway , Frnt A , New York City , NY 10027-4123 2737 Broadway , Frnt A , New York City, NY 10027-4123
ReviewText: We went to this neighborhood place because we found an online deal, but we'd go again even without one. The four of us shared two apps (pulled pork and mac 'n' cheese...both very good). For our mains, we had three variations of burgers (lamb, salmon and beef) and one croque madame, each served with salad or fries. The portions were enormous and delicious. Nice beer selections. At about 9PM, a jazz trio started to play; they sounded great but we couldn't stay. Next time, we'll come for dinner and music.
ReviewTitle: Live jazz was a pleasant surprise

ProviderLocation: 2737 Broadway , Frnt A , New York City , NY 10027-4123 2737 Broadway , Frnt A , New York City, NY 10027-4123
ReviewText: Waited 40 minutes for a burger ...restaurant wasn't even busy. The recovery was bartender saying "god bless you " on the way out which was totally inappropriate and false advertisement on menu. They offer $5 Mimosas with brunch item and when the bill comes its $7 and the explanation is "oh there $5 after first one" smh I was a regular that won't be back

ProviderLocation: 2737 Broadway , Frnt A , New York City , NY 10027-4123 2737 Broadway , Frnt A , New York City, NY 10027-4123
ReviewText: If you are hungry and in the area of Columbia University upper west side, there are not a ton of lunch places.mThis place has a standard american lunch menu- salads, sandwiches, burgers. the portions are generous. the food is good but not great . My medium burger came out correctly but the huge huge plate of fries were nothing special. service is too claustrophobic and in your face. but you will not leave hungry.

ProviderLocation: 2737 Broadway , Frnt A , New York City , NY 10027-4123 2737 Broadway , Frnt A , New York City, NY 10027-4123
ReviewText: This place has all the things I like: diverse American food choices, outside seating, and good service. Great neighborhood place for any meal. There is a lot of competition in this neighborhood yet it is consistently busy.

ProviderLocation: 2737 Broadway , Frnt A , New York City , NY 10027-4123 2737 Broadway , Frnt A , New York City, NY 10027-4123
ReviewText: I wouldn't go out of my way for this one. Special entrees but this place near Columbia is big on burgers, salads, and apps. However, I went for an entrée of baked chicken and quinoa. It was ample for a dinner, but the chicken wasn't very tasty. I added a salad for just a dollar which is a really good deal. Service, though, was mighty poor. My server left during my meal and his sequel didn't pay much attention to me, just to hover around to give me the check. One benefit here, though, is that the open hours are later than some of the surrounding eating venues. There's a small bar area. If I would come here again I think I would get better service sitting here, at the bar. Just a hint.

ProviderLocation: 2737 Broadway , Frnt A , New York City , NY 10027-4123 2737 Broadway , Frnt A , New York City, NY 10027-4123
ReviewText: I tried the pizza and salad which were good but I would try other items next time such as the rosemary and French Fries. One of the nicest stops in the neighborhood with the widest variety.

ProviderLocation: 120 Mulberry St Apt 1 , New York City , NY 10013-4693 120 Mulberry St Apt 1 , New York City, NY 10013-4693
ReviewText: Loved everything about this restaurant. The decorations, the Christmas music playing, our table next to the window. Our food was delicious. The bread, the salad, my spaghetti with shrimp and vodka sauce, and my husbands lasagna. Can't say enough good things. Staff was very helpful and looked like they were all helping each other. Only place to eat in Little Italy for sure! Can't wait to go back someday!

ProviderLocation: 120 Mulberry St Apt 1 , New York City , NY 10013-4693 120 Mulberry St Apt 1 , New York City, NY 10013-4693
ReviewText: We were lucky to get a patio table on a busy, beautiful night so that was a large part of the experience. The food was OK, my husband had Lasagna which he thought was good and I had 2 appetizers calamari, which I think were frozen and a stuffed artichoke that was heavy with bread but not much flavor. The wine was reasonable and the service was good. I think that it is hit and miss with the food. It is OK but there are probably better choices on Mulberry St.

ProviderLocation: 120 Mulberry St Apt 1 , New York City , NY 10013-4693 120 Mulberry St Apt 1 , New York City, NY 10013-4693
ReviewText: The pasta is great, no pizza available, large glasses of nice wine for $7, very limited selection of beer. Recommended for a cheap meal before heading off to the bars.
ReviewTitle: Nice food, limited selection of beer

ProviderLocation: 120 Mulberry St Apt 1 , New York City , NY 10013-4693 120 Mulberry St Apt 1 , New York City, NY 10013-4693
ReviewText: We have been here 3 times over the past 15 years and love coming back to it. It's like going home. We were able to sit in the courtyard each time and enjoy the beautiful weather NYC offers.

ProviderLocation: 120 Mulberry St Apt 1 , New York City , NY 10013-4693 120 Mulberry St Apt 1 , New York City, NY 10013-4693
ReviewText: I came with my wife for a little italy experience. We order spaghetti carbonara and penne a la vodka. Was great the plates. I lived in Italy and i am familiar with italian cucine. Nice servers, very gently and friendly. I give 4 stars cause we didn't take the 20% off for the first check in from yelp. It still running but our server told me that this is from last year.. Take it off then :-)

ProviderLocation: 120 Mulberry St Apt 1 , New York City , NY 10013-4693 120 Mulberry St Apt 1 , New York City, NY 10013-4693
ReviewText: This little hidden gem has been my go to restaurant for over 15 years. It does not matter the time of year or time of day the staff is excellent and the food is great. They go out of there way to accommodate small or large parties. Inside or out you cannot beat the price for the food. I love Ernesto who always remembers me no matter how long between visits. Love and recommend this hidden gem in Little Italy.

ProviderLocation: 246 Spring St , New York City , NY 10013-1521 246 Spring St , New York City, NY 10013-1521
ReviewText: Definately not worth the trip or the price. I expected more from a NY sushi restaurant in Trump Soho. The place was empty on a Saturday night and the service was marginal. The meal was definately overpriced for the quality. Go Back? NO.

ProviderLocation: 246 Spring St , New York City , NY 10013-1521 246 Spring St , New York City, NY 10013-1521
ReviewText: We were looking for a Japanese or Japanese fusion restaurant. The ambience was good but we thought the food was overpriced and less than average. The waitress who took our order was good but the staff who served our food were poor, plonking down our plates on top of our cutlery and waking away without a word. It seems that this restaurant thinks that by serving raw fish they are serving Japanese food. The food bore little resemblance to Japanese of even Japanese fusion. The signature dish was just oily rice. We will not return.

ProviderLocation: 246 Spring St , New York City , NY 10013-1521 246 Spring St , New York City, NY 10013-1521
ReviewText: I ordered room service from Koi, however the dinner was exceptional. The tuna tartar was fresh & clean. The dumplings were succulent & served hot in a traditional bamboo steamer. Simply delicious!
ReviewTitle: Tuna Tartar & steamed dumplings were superb!

ProviderLocation: 246 Spring St , New York City , NY 10013-1521 246 Spring St , New York City, NY 10013-1521
ReviewText: Delicious sushi/appetizers and amazing service! Highly recommend you eat here if you visit New York City!

ProviderLocation: 246 Spring St , New York City , NY 10013-1521 246 Spring St , New York City, NY 10013-1521
ReviewText: After a late flight we didnt want to go too far from the hotel so decided to try the in-house restaurant. We had the seared tuna and it was amazing! Cocktails were Ok and it had a limited wine list Overall very good.

ProviderLocation: 246 Spring St , New York City , NY 10013-1521 246 Spring St , New York City, NY 10013-1521
ReviewText: Ate here once while staying at the Trump. Class fine dining restaurant Japanese-themed food, intimate dark setting, and great service. Had two course and both were absolutely superb. Expensive, but was worthwhile for a treat. Suit couples.

ProviderLocation: 103 E Broadway , New York City , NY 10002-7062 103 E Broadway , New York City, NY 10002-7062
ReviewText: Nothing fancy. But a great place to grab a bite when you just want to eat and get on with your travels. Prices cannot be beat!
ReviewTitle: Want cheap eats when you are on the go?

ProviderLocation: 103 E Broadway , New York City , NY 10002-7062 103 E Broadway , New York City, NY 10002-7062
ReviewText: I don’t want to sound like a shill, but you really can’t go wrong at New Wong. They are open from 8:00 AM to 9:00 PM. They do not have a website, they do not serve alcohol, they do not take credit cards. This is a Hong Kong styled rice and noodle shop. You can be in and out in less than 30 minutes. I sometimes have lunch here once or twice a week. The basic roast pork and white meat chicken (boneless breast) which is accompanied by a delicious scallion ginger sauce, a small side portion of a vegetable and house soup; will cost you $5.50. This is a very complete meal. Other items that I regularly eat here include: Any “Congee”—a rice type porridge Any of the “Hong Kong Style Noodle” dishes—Egg noodles on a reduced broth, topped with the protein you have a taste for Any “Hot Rice Entrée”--Fish Filets are lightly breaded and fried, truly fabulous Experiment with the menu it is very affordable, the staff is most helpful; many of them speak good to very good English. Restaurants like this are what make New York such a cultural and culinary delight.
ReviewTitle: As good as going to Hong Kong

ProviderLocation: 489 Columbus Ave , New York City , NY 10024-4624 489 Columbus Ave , New York City, NY 10024-4624
ReviewText: Excellent lunch. This restaurant is a little bit off the beaten path. We found it one afternoon while sightseeing near Central Park. It had started to drizzle, so we decided it was time for a lunch break. This place popped up on my search engine, and, as it was only a few blocks away, we decided to take a chance. Turned out to be a very good choice. The food was tasty and reasonably priced. The restaurant is small, but comfortable. The wait staff were attentive and helpful. And, it's only a few blocks from the Museum of Natural History, which is a favorite destination for us. It is a block west of Central Park West and 2.5 blocks north of the museum in a neighborhood that looks like it caters more to locals than to tourists. A good find for us and hopefully others will look it up as well.

ProviderLocation: 489 Columbus Ave , New York City , NY 10024-4624 489 Columbus Ave , New York City, NY 10024-4624
ReviewText: Excellent Indian food. Really enjoyed our dinner here. Clean, quiet, pleasant staff, nice quality ingredients, well prepared. Pleasant setting.

ProviderLocation: 489 Columbus Ave , New York City , NY 10024-4624 489 Columbus Ave , New York City, NY 10024-4624
ReviewText: I went there for a lunch. Waiter who seated me was so rude. He didnt even let me to ask questions about menu.i ate chicken curry it was ok. But this person attitude kill it.

ProviderLocation: 489 Columbus Ave , New York City , NY 10024-4624 489 Columbus Ave , New York City, NY 10024-4624
ReviewText: I happened upon this restaurant walking up Columbus Avenue looking for a place for lunch. What a find! Excellent lunch specials (salad, main course, rice, and naan for $11), attentive service, classy design, and quiet enough to have a conversation. My only disappointment is that I live in MN, and must await another trip to NYC to go back again.
ReviewTitle: A Small Treasure on the Upper West Side

ProviderLocation: 32 Avenue a , Between 2nd and 3rd streets , New York City , NY 10009-7654 32 Avenue a , Between 2nd and 3rd streets , New York City, NY 10009-7654
ReviewText: Great Irish pub in East Village. Food is in credible! Crab cakes and salmon were comparable in presentation and taste to more expensive restaurants.... But at half the price. Run by Irish family. Great drinks.

ProviderLocation: 17 E. 32nd St. , New York City , NY 10016 17 E. 32nd St. , New York City, NY 10016
ReviewText: Some ups and downs here. Food was excellent. Was here twice and all the side dishes that come with the entrées are wonderful and were different both times but most are very spicy/hot. One night one of the side dishes was seaweed and it was not hot but was delish. One night I had the boneless short ribs spicy and they were wonderful. The second night I had the marinated prime rib eye and that was even better. The steak was melt in your mouth and it was not an overpowering marinade. All the dipping sauces are great. Both times we had the fried dumplings and they are great. Jan had the Galbi both times and loved it. Why not an excellent rating? Because of the service. The first time it was a little above ave, the second time way below ave. It took at least 10 minutes for any waiter to acknowledge we were there and after that the service was okay but when we were done eating nobody came for our bill so we had to go to the cashier area ourselves. This the service and overall rating.

ProviderLocation: 17 E. 32nd St. , New York City , NY 10016 17 E. 32nd St. , New York City, NY 10016
ReviewText: Over the course of about 10 lunches in the past two years I've come to rate this highly. Always a generous selection of about 8 Korean "amuse bouches" before the main course. Many interesting appetizers. Delicious meat selections served on hot plates, some with side stew dishes. You can splurge on a la carte or stick to lunch menu selections for below $15. Oh, that bottle of Chum Churum brand of soju for $16 is the best and smoothest 20% alcohol drink value in the city. More than enough for two persons.

ProviderLocation: 17 E. 32nd St. , New York City , NY 10016 17 E. 32nd St. , New York City, NY 10016
ReviewText: Not according to Michelin standards,but good position in Korea area, good service,nothing special about the food.A trusted place to eat when you are in the area.Nothing more

ProviderLocation: 17 E. 32nd St. , New York City , NY 10016 17 E. 32nd St. , New York City, NY 10016
ReviewText: First time to a Korean BBQ at your table. When the staff is literally cooking your meal inches away from you they have to be attentive to be certain the food is cooked correctly. Well......the food not only cooked perfectly but DELICIOUS! I would highly suggest a reservation. The bar area is a bit tight but wine and all spirits were very good.

ProviderLocation: 17 E. 32nd St. , New York City , NY 10016 17 E. 32nd St. , New York City, NY 10016
ReviewText: The meats are marinated and then cooked right on the table in a traditional Korean style. Clean, great intimate ambience. Somewhat slow but generally attentive service. I grew up eating this food all of my life. It's very good meat and I enjoyed my visit. But this place has few caveats. First, the grill is natural gas grill. For a full flavored real Korean BBQ, wood chip grill should be used. Second, the side dishes are somewhat limited. There should be more variety. I would return and recommend

ProviderLocation: 3302 Broadway , Astoria, NY 11106 , New York City , NY 10031-8701 3302 Broadway , Astoria, NY 11106 , New York City, NY 10031-8701
ReviewText: Last year I said: Came back again and we are still of the opinion that this Sushi restaurant is good and we will come back again. Fresh, delicate and enjoyable. Service is still excellent. We enjoyed also a good Chicken Teriyaki. Still a very good place. They had happy hour on this Saturday and we enjoyed that. Try it
ReviewTitle: You should try it we will be back

ProviderLocation: 3302 Broadway , Astoria, NY 11106 , New York City , NY 10031-8701 3302 Broadway , Astoria, NY 11106 , New York City, NY 10031-8701
ReviewText: Came back again and we are still of the opinion that this Sushi restaurant is good and we will come back again. Fresh, delicate and enjoyable. Service is still excellent.

ProviderLocation: 3302 Broadway , Astoria, NY 11106 , New York City , NY 10031-8701 3302 Broadway , Astoria, NY 11106 , New York City, NY 10031-8701
ReviewText: The Picture for Junko Sushi is not correct. It is a very reasonable Sushi restaurant and the food is good and the service is good as well. The food is fresh and we do recommend you to try it. They have good lunch offers.
ReviewTitle: Do not agree with the review given

ProviderLocation: 3302 Broadway , Astoria, NY 11106 , New York City , NY 10031-8701 3302 Broadway , Astoria, NY 11106 , New York City, NY 10031-8701
ReviewText: I came upon Junko Sushi wandering around Astoria one evening. The menu looked appealing and I was in the mood for some good Japanese cuisine, so I popped in on a whim. I ordered the unagi don - it's among the best I've had in terms of preparation and presentation. (I'm sorry I didn't snap a photo.) I also had pork gyoza to start - nothing spectacular, but still quite good. I'd give this place five stars if not for one of the waitresses seeming rather...annoyed that I was coming in as a solo diner on a Saturday night. It made me feel a little unwelcome. Fortunately, my main waitress was an absolute joy and made sure I was taken care of. That salvaged the experience for me. Would I consider coming back? Yes, but maybe next time I'll bring a guest.
ReviewTitle: Junko sushi: A good last-minute decision

ProviderLocation: 5 E 38th St , New York City , NY 10016 5 E 38th St , New York City, NY 10016
ReviewText: Nice gastropub with a lot of wood accents. Our waitress, Allison, was very friendly and efficient. I had broiled salmon with asparagus, wife had grilled trout with avocado salad. Both were good sized portions, very fresh and delicious and reasonably priced at $25 & $21. It was national french fries day so we added a side of fries for $5...very good shoestring fries...totally worth it! Excellent food and excellent service! Will definitely eat here again when back in city! Btw, we had a Group-on but would eat here again even without one.
ReviewTitle: Bar atmosphere with very good food and service

ProviderLocation: 5 E 38th St , New York City , NY 10016 5 E 38th St , New York City, NY 10016
ReviewText: In stead of heading to the crowded Times Square we choose to stop for an easy dinner at a local bar. We didn't have high expectations and those were barely fulfilled. My food was ok (both starter and main) while my wifes dishes were no good. Duck confit was more like the det Turkey in National Lampoons Christmas Vacation... Waitress was really friendly and serviceminded, which keeps my rating up a little.

ProviderLocation: 5 E 38th St , New York City , NY 10016 5 E 38th St , New York City, NY 10016
ReviewText: We enjoyed the beer selection, and the service was very good as well. The food was just so-so, and it had a very limited dinner menu (about 6 or 7 items)
ReviewTitle: Great bar, great service, fair food

ProviderLocation: 5 E 38th St , New York City , NY 10016 5 E 38th St , New York City, NY 10016
ReviewText: We had dinner here before going to a Broadway show. This place seems to be more of a bar than a restaurant. We sat opposite the bar at a booth. The booth was old & tired looking. Service was ok but the food was sorely lacking. We started with focaccia bread with goat cheese which was pretty good. We both had as our main course gnocchi. It was fried (!) & came with mushrooms & some grated cheese - no sauce. It was dry, too chewy and for the most part tasteless. Would never bother dining here again.

ProviderLocation: 5 E 38th St , New York City , NY 10016 5 E 38th St , New York City, NY 10016
ReviewText: We stopped in here for dinner - great location near 5th Avenue. The big problem was there were a couple of 'works' dos going on and it was really noisy. Later in the evening it quietened down a bit but I still had to shout to talk to the person next to me. But the food was excellent. My husband had the burger and said it was the best he had ever had - quite a compliment. I had pasta in a red wine sauce and it was absolutely delicious - I would definitely recommend the food but maybe go somewhere else if you want a quiet dinner.
ReviewTitle: Great food just a bit noisy

ProviderLocation: 5 E 38th St , New York City , NY 10016 5 E 38th St , New York City, NY 10016
ReviewText: I don't find Butterfield 8 to be exceptional in any way but it is an above average bar/restaurant in just about every way. The bar area is spacious and they have TV's everywhere so it's a bit of a sports bar accent on what is otherwise a typical NYC bar/Irish Bar type place. The menu is good for the bar food, burgers, etc. They seem to try to put some fancier dishes on the menu to be some kind of gastropub or something more than a bar and grill, but I don't know how those foods are. I'm very happy with the burgers, wings, and other bar foods. It is not a cheap place but I wouldn't say it's expensive... reasonable prices. The staff are courteous (and seems they are all attractive, don't know if it's by design or coincidence, but OK with me) and the service can be mediocre but usually is above average; it's never been bad service for me here. Bottom line, I don't go out of my way to eat here usually, but on occasion I choose it; I would say you can't go wrong here but it won't be anything exceptional or much different from other pub/restaurants in the area. As I said, it's above average but not exceptional.

ProviderLocation: 5 E 38th St , New York City , NY 10016 5 E 38th St , New York City, NY 10016
ReviewText: Dropped in to this beautiful well appointed bar for a lunch while wandering the city today. Was welcomed by an Irish bar lady who was real Irish not pretend American. Was engaged in conversation & served a nice meal that was exactly what it said on the tin. Beer & burger. Was an enjoyable experience all round. Nice service, good food & environment.

ProviderLocation: 5 E 38th St , New York City , NY 10016 5 E 38th St , New York City, NY 10016
ReviewText: Nice drinks, fun bar atmosphere, restaurant space is small. Overall food is good, nice appetizers - great place to meet friends for drinks, or have lunch. Good for business lunch.

ProviderLocation: 209 E 56th St , 56th Street Bet. 2nd and 3rd Aves , New York City , NY 10022-3705 209 E 56th St , 56th Street Bet. 2nd and 3rd Aves , New York City, NY 10022-3705
ReviewText: The food was good, but nothing special. The problem was with the uneven service. We were not sure if the busboy was our waiter or who was taking care of our table. Our friends had eaten here several times & felt because it was a Sunday night they did not use their regular staff. This is not an excuse when you are paying around $135 per couple.

ProviderLocation: 209 E 56th St , 56th Street Bet. 2nd and 3rd Aves , New York City , NY 10022-3705 209 E 56th St , 56th Street Bet. 2nd and 3rd Aves , New York City, NY 10022-3705
ReviewText: I don't give 5 stars. That said, This is the first time we've been here. I've been disappointed so many times before.seeking out an Italian restaurant in Manhattan that we enjoy and would go back to. Here are our criteria. We love when the maitre d' or management takes care of its customers. Kudos to Jerome. Charming and friendly. We like ambiance, white table cloths and impeccable service. Amata has all of this. Loved the Tuscan red wine. We love the kind of food we love. Clams oreganato were very good. Great bread to slop up the sauce. My chicken Parmigiana was huge and perfectly prepared with exactly the kind of tomato sauce I love. My gal's linguine vongole was great. We asked for a Moscoto d'asti as an after dinner drink which they were out of, but they gave us a substitute which was excellent. Then they gave us two shots of a peach snapps with vodka on the house as an appreciation. Well, guys, we appreciate you and we'll be back - with friends!

ProviderLocation: 209 E 56th St , 56th Street Bet. 2nd and 3rd Aves , New York City , NY 10022-3705 209 E 56th St , 56th Street Bet. 2nd and 3rd Aves , New York City, NY 10022-3705
ReviewText: Just walking around looking for a restaurant and came upon Amata. Our meals and service were both great! Excellent pork chop and delicious pasta. Plus the staff is extremely attentive and nice. Even the wine was great! We will recommend this to NYC friends. If you are looking for a good meal and a quiet restaurant - definitely try it!

ProviderLocation: 209 E 56th St , 56th Street Bet. 2nd and 3rd Aves , New York City , NY 10022-3705 209 E 56th St , 56th Street Bet. 2nd and 3rd Aves , New York City, NY 10022-3705
ReviewText: Our 6:30 dinner reservation brought us to the restaurant at an un-crowded time when the restaurant was not noisy - good strategy if one has a hearing impairment. We had delicious carpaccio, pappardelle with crab meat and cavatelli with sausage & broccoli. Desserts and wine were both excellent. We'll be back

ProviderLocation: 209 E 56th St , 56th Street Bet. 2nd and 3rd Aves , New York City , NY 10022-3705 209 E 56th St , 56th Street Bet. 2nd and 3rd Aves , New York City, NY 10022-3705
ReviewText: Came in on a Friday night just as they were closing down the kitchen. Despite this the service was very gracious but efficient. We ordered a salad to start and the waiter offered to split it for us on two plates, which is not something you see frequently. The mains were both excellent, with a very generous portion size. Wine list was very good and the wine available by the glass was also very high quality. Prices were reasonable, salad, two mains and two glasses of wine for $100, and we were stuffed. One thing that could be improved is the quality of the specials -- overall it was fairly standard fare (branzino, steak, etc). The chef could be a little bit more creative. But as a local, straightforward restaurant they really nail it: good food, fantastic service and nice decor.

ProviderLocation: 209 E 56th St , 56th Street Bet. 2nd and 3rd Aves , New York City , NY 10022-3705 209 E 56th St , 56th Street Bet. 2nd and 3rd Aves , New York City, NY 10022-3705
ReviewText: The website enticed. The menu intrigued. Sadly, the food disappointed, a case history of lack of attention to detail and timing. I ordered calamari fritti, expecting crisp morsels of baby squid. The dish served was no longer calamari fritti but calamari softie, doused in sauce. My second choice was a special: pan-fried zucchini flowers. Again, I expected crisp flowers. Unfortunately, the dish had been left too long on the kitchen servery. Its crispness had steamed away. The service was charming but the check, of course, was not reduced to compensate for the dishes.

ProviderLocation: 264 West 46th Street , New York City , NY 10036-1408 264 West 46th Street , New York City, NY 10036-1408
ReviewText: The website says breakfast until 10:45am. We ran there to be there at 10:30am and we were told by a very rude staff at reception that breakfast is over and they're only serving lunch now. Not good, will not go there again. Looks like they do not rely on any new customers.

ProviderLocation: 264 West 46th Street , New York City , NY 10036-1408 264 West 46th Street , New York City, NY 10036-1408
ReviewText: We stopped really quick to get some new York style cheesecake. There is an entrance to the restaurant and a small spot to order some desserts togo/ eat outside (which is what we did) they have lots of different choices of cheesecake by the slice and for a whole. Also some black and white cookies, ruglach, and a few other desserts. We got a apple crumb cheesecake it and was really good! The only downside was that it was super cold, almost frozen. But tasted like apple crumb pie and cheesecake together!

ProviderLocation: 264 West 46th Street , New York City , NY 10036-1408 264 West 46th Street , New York City, NY 10036-1408
ReviewText: We chose this as our breakfast restaurant of choice for our recent stay in NYC.....although only using it for breakfast it was open all day and was a cheesecake specialist to boot! We found the wait to get in...non-existant :) The service was fast friendly and excellent...the menu was varied and choices were good and for the centre of Manhattan were reasonably priced. Food when it came was hot and a large portion....all in all would recommend this place highly!

ProviderLocation: 264 West 46th Street , New York City , NY 10036-1408 264 West 46th Street , New York City, NY 10036-1408
ReviewText: We struggled with breakfast until we found this place and I wish we had have found it sooner, french toast with bacon is totally amazing, ill be visiting this more often when we go back lol.

ProviderLocation: 264 West 46th Street , New York City , NY 10036-1408 264 West 46th Street , New York City, NY 10036-1408
ReviewText: The Food at juniors fit the saying of "comfort food". The food is great, fairly priced, with a great team that runs the place. Our server was great our host was amazing too and it was overall just a great vibe.

ProviderLocation: 264 West 46th Street , New York City , NY 10036-1408 264 West 46th Street , New York City, NY 10036-1408
ReviewText: Ate here 3 times since it was in front of my hotel. The only decent thing was the breakfast other than that I wouldnt recommend it. Had the brisket and it taste it like old ARMY food, terrible. Tuna salad sandwich, terrible and the prices are pretty high for the low end food they put out.

ProviderLocation: 264 West 46th Street , New York City , NY 10036-1408 264 West 46th Street , New York City, NY 10036-1408
ReviewText: I usually like a table and don't sit at the bar, but did this time since they were so busy and I was dining alone. Service at the bar was great. I had their turkey dinner and it was perfect. Prices here are excellent too. You can't go wrong here. Good for families too. Try the raspberry swirl cheesecake, if you like cheesecake, as theirs is the best!

ProviderLocation: 264 West 46th Street , New York City , NY 10036-1408 264 West 46th Street , New York City, NY 10036-1408
ReviewText: I was seated promptly. I had a wonderful server. Food came out fast and it was hot and delicious. I opted for the Turkey dinner that comes with dressing, green beans, mashed potatoes, gray, and cranberry sauce. It was all excellent! For dessert I had a sundae. I like the complimentary slaw, beets, and pickles that are provided. This is one of my favorite places in the Times Square area to eat. They have a very varied menu and everything I have ever ordered here has been good.
ReviewTitle: It was Excellent all the way around!

ProviderLocation: 264 West 46th Street , New York City , NY 10036-1408 264 West 46th Street , New York City, NY 10036-1408
ReviewText: Fun atmosphere. Priced Well. Amazing Cheesecake! Great location for before or after a night at the theatre!
ReviewTitle: The place to go for the 24 Breakfast. Followed with cheesecake made for the gods!

ProviderLocation: 218 West 35th Street , 5th Floor, Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel , New York City , NY 10001-2562 218 West 35th Street , 5th Floor, Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel , New York City, NY 10001-2562
ReviewText: We stopped by here at noon to check it out as we heard they had fantastic burgers...so we returned to have them at dinner. At noon, the place was quiet. We came back at 6 PM and it was beginning to fill up for the evening rush but the bar rush had already started. It was just unbelievably loud. Could not hear each other talk. Now to the food. Fantastic food. The burgers were served hot, really hot. Never had a burger served like it was immediately off the grill. Very good. The fries were fresh and hot. Very good again. We ordered the Irish Nachos which were amazing. Never had anything like them before. Probably won't be back due to the noise but the food and service were great!

ProviderLocation: 218 West 35th Street , 5th Floor, Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel , New York City , NY 10001-2562 218 West 35th Street , 5th Floor, Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel , New York City, NY 10001-2562
ReviewText: This restaurant is on the 5th floor of the Renaissance Midtown hotel, and the hotel uses it for breakfast. We had coupons from the hotel for the buffet breakfast and it was very underwhelming. The food was cold and the selection very limited. I certainly would not pay full price for it. Other reviews stated that the a la carte breakfast was better, I cannot comment on that. We did try to eat dinner here one night, it was very quiet (although it was Dec 26th). I ordered the grilled cheese and soup, the menu stated that it was a cheddar and gruyere grilled cheese sandwich but what came was a mozzerella, tomato and basil sandwich. I pointed this out to the waiter and he said they change it sometimes, this was very poor service, especially since this is not a cheap place. The environment is nice but the service and food left a lot to be desired.

ProviderLocation: 218 West 35th Street , 5th Floor, Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel , New York City , NY 10001-2562 218 West 35th Street , 5th Floor, Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel , New York City, NY 10001-2562
ReviewText: Our first morning we went down for breakfast and probably should have asked for a menu. Neither one of us eat enough to make the $26 buffet price worth it, but I have to say the scrambled eggs were the best ever at a buffet. The pastries were quite good as well. We went back for dinner on our third night with our son. He really liked his turkey burger, and my grilled cheese and soup were good as well. I prefer a non-buttered sandwich and this was on crispy bread so perfect for me.

ProviderLocation: 218 West 35th Street , 5th Floor, Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel , New York City , NY 10001-2562 218 West 35th Street , 5th Floor, Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel , New York City, NY 10001-2562
ReviewText: My wife and I stopped in for lunch on Saturday during Christmas season. The restaurant was not very crowded, so that should've been a sign. We waited about 20 minutes for a waitress to come take our order. My wife ordered a salad and asked if there were any onions in it, and the waitress said no onions. The salad came loaded with onions. She sent it back and when it finally came back to the table, they had picked out most of the onions but there were still some in the salad. It's a good thing she simply doesn't like onions rather than having an allergy to them! After they cleared the table, it took another 30 minutes to get the check. Horrible service in a mediocre restaurant in a great setting.
ReviewTitle: The best the Renaissance can do? Not even close.

ProviderLocation: 218 West 35th Street , 5th Floor, Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel , New York City , NY 10001-2562 218 West 35th Street , 5th Floor, Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel , New York City, NY 10001-2562
ReviewText: We booked this a week in advance before heading to Madison Square Garden. They required a credit card to hold the reservation and called to confirm the reservation. Setting is spectacular, particularly rooftop bar area which you should request in advance. Service once seated was really great and we didn't want for anything for long! We had pizza, crostini, tomato soup, sliders and Irish nachos. We weren't huge fans of the Irish nachos: think kettle chips with velveeta cheese, but everything else was good. We would absolutely return.
ReviewTitle: Spectacular setting, great service, good food

ProviderLocation: 218 West 35th Street , 5th Floor, Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel , New York City , NY 10001-2562 218 West 35th Street , 5th Floor, Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel , New York City, NY 10001-2562
ReviewText: Loved eating here! went back twice and had the same meal twice... it was that good! The restaurant is located within the renaissance midtown hotel on 35th. I ordered the burger and parmesan/garlic chips. Burger was lovely, but the chips are AMAZING! I also tried the hibiscus cocktail, which was really nice. Burger and cocktail came to about $24. The Irish bartender is really friendly and welcoming.

ProviderLocation: 218 West 35th Street , 5th Floor, Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel , New York City , NY 10001-2562 218 West 35th Street , 5th Floor, Renaissance New York Midtown Hotel , New York City, NY 10001-2562
ReviewText: Stayed in hotel and went here for dinner before heading out to another event. I was rushed and ordered a salad to keep things simple and quick. Asked for dressing on side. Salad came dressed and I asked to have it corrected. New one came out promptly and manager offered to have cost removed from bill. I think that was a very classy move and appreciated it. My service from waiter - Igor was excellent and prompt
ReviewTitle: Great service and food - fixed my mistake

ProviderLocation: 15 Stone St , New York City , NY 10004-2212 15 Stone St , New York City, NY 10004-2212
ReviewText: The place is nice, not too big and not too small. My french onion soup was great, my wife's starter was tomatoes and onion, and all they did was cut a tomato in thick slices and the same for the onion. NOT GOOD ATT ALL. We shared a 16oz steak, and that was really amazing.

ProviderLocation: 15 Stone St , New York City , NY 10004-2212 15 Stone St , New York City, NY 10004-2212
ReviewText: Ate here as it was over the road from our hotel and we were all tired from a days sight seeing. The restaurant is wooden paneled inside and is nicely laid out with space between the tables. The atmophere was reserved and the music was not too loud, the waiters were attentive without being intrusive. I ordered surf and turf and was not disappionted. The steak was cooked to perfection (medium rare) and was so tasty, the lobbster tail was large and very subtle in flavour. The steak fries that I ordered were excellent, thick and chunky with the skins on, the side of wild mushrooms were good and there were loads of them.(order 1 between 2 if you dine here). The wine we chose was very good indeed and complimented the meal realy well. I would certainly recommend the restaurant, but not if you are on a budget.

ProviderLocation: 15 Stone St , New York City , NY 10004-2212 15 Stone St , New York City, NY 10004-2212
ReviewText: Nebraska is the best unknown Steakhouse in NYC. The steaks are top shelf and the service is even better. If you go, please ask to sit at Armenian Mike's table. Mike is the best waiter in all of NYC. The appetizers are great and the steaks are even better. New owners just took over and now they are opened on weekends. They offer brunch on Saturday and Sunday's. PLEASE VISIT NEBRASKA

ProviderLocation: 15 Stone St , New York City , NY 10004-2212 15 Stone St , New York City, NY 10004-2212
ReviewText: The cost does not match the food. No veg, greasy onion rings and potato wedges, overcook fish, meat good. Cost for the food wow.......

ProviderLocation: 15 Stone St , New York City , NY 10004-2212 15 Stone St , New York City, NY 10004-2212
ReviewText: Old School feeling, which is what we like in a steak house. My husband and I started with a drink at the bar while we waited for our friends, We enjoyed conversation with other patrons. Seems to be a popular after work spot for the Wall Street crowd. The food and service were excellent. My only negative was that I thought the sides would be slightly larger. We ordered 2 sides for the table. Although we also had salads to start, 2 sides was not quite enough. I would order at least 3 sides for 4 people next time. Will return.

ProviderLocation: 15 Stone St , New York City , NY 10004-2212 15 Stone St , New York City, NY 10004-2212
ReviewText: This place in Stone Street, financial district and opposite the Double Tree Hotel, is a hidden gem! I love the place and the elegant styling; I loved the wonderful marble bar, where you can eat when you are alone, I loved the attentive waiters and/or bar men/ bar ladies. As a starter I had oysters Rockefeller to die for! And the grilled Salmon was " a point". Love to return and recommend it! When you are lodging in the financial district; this is THE place for lunch and dinner!!!

ProviderLocation: 15 Stone St , New York City , NY 10004-2212 15 Stone St , New York City, NY 10004-2212
ReviewText: Located on a side street 4 or 5 blocks from Wall Street, across form a Doubletree Hotel.. Service at the big, long bar is excellent. Order the beef sliders for nibbles while at the bar... they are quick, hot, and delicious.
ReviewTitle: Great Little Hidden Gem near Wall Street

ProviderLocation: 15 Stone St , New York City , NY 10004-2212 15 Stone St , New York City, NY 10004-2212
ReviewText: Medium Rare!.. Too often the request for medium-rare means the edges will be well-done. When it comes to bone-in, at high-end steak houses, it's a cap shoot... BUT!!! Nebraska was pitched a curve ball (medium-rare bone-in) and knocked it out of the ball park!.. When I saw the charged meat I just knew they had ruined the steak... BUT!!! Much to my surprise every single slice of the steak WAS IN FACT MEDIUM-RARE from the first cut, to the last bite 1hour later (28oz) GREAT STEAK!!!

ProviderLocation: 15 Stone St , New York City , NY 10004-2212 15 Stone St , New York City, NY 10004-2212
ReviewText: I live in the neighborhood and love steak so I am always in search of the best steak here in the downtown financial area and this is not it. In fact, I really think Google maps should not list them as a steakhouse when I search for steakhouse. You come in, bar is small and tightly spaced. First thing you'll notice are the bartenders and you wonder if you're in a strip club. Don't worry, they're skimpily clothed. Should be a plus if you're a guy, right? Probably. Unfortunately, if you want to eat at the bar this is a very bad thing. They're basically their to flirt and keep customers, mainly Wall St types drinking. They were so busy talking that I cannot order for at least a good 20 minutes. When one of them finally come around actually working, she did not really understand English and spoke in a heavy European accent. I say I wanted the surf and turf which is one of their specialties and she was like we had that? Then she tried to find it in the menu. I also told her if I can get the steak first and then the lobster. I always find one of them cold when served together and she said sure. The food took forever to come while the bartenders just continue working, oh I mean talking to customers. Now I know the importance of being friendly and light chit chat to establish good relationship with clientele but this is extreme. Theses women are basically doing nothing but talking. I'm thinking my food is ready and they don't even know. Finally someone brought the food to the bar but he did not know who it's for so left it at the inner bar counter. Sure enough, it was just sitting there and not served to me because these bartending women are still busy chatting with customers. I tried to tell them, but too loud in here and to no avail. When finally they realized that the food was behind them, it was cold. And what's this? Why is the lobster there? I was like I wanted the lobster afterwards and so she took the lobster and place it on another plate and place it behind her on the counter and then continue chatting again. Wow, just wow. Normally, you should send this back but not really my style. I quickly finished my cold steak which might've been good, who knows...if it was hot. Then asked if I could get the cold lobster at the counter behind her and then proceed to finish that as fast as I can. Of course, it took another 20 minutes to get the check. She's now sharing her pictures with another customer...wow, just wow. The customer was like this guy just ordered a steak and lobster, you should show him your pictures. I smiled and said no thank you and she gave a disgusted look and said fine, I don't want to show them to you anyway. What I really wanted to say is no, I don't want to look at your stinking pictures, just the check please which I asked for like 20 minutes ago. You've been warned.

ProviderLocation: 15 Stone St , New York City , NY 10004-2212 15 Stone St , New York City, NY 10004-2212
ReviewText: I planned to have a decent steak at Wolfgang's, when I noticed this restaurant just in front of my hotel. I decided to give it a shot and went for their signature dish, "The Steak", a $42 prime rib. It was far from being a good steak. The chef burnt it "to death", so it was almost completely blackened from the outside. the inside was hardly pinkish (i asked for a MR), and the taste itself was very mediocre. Bottom line - If you fancy a great steak and you consider Nebraska - think again and head to Wolfgang's.

ProviderLocation: 401 E 62nd St , New York City , NY 10065-7910 401 E 62nd St , New York City, NY 10065-7910
ReviewText: This is a very authentic Turkish restaurant with good food, good service and good prices! You can BYOB, a great benefit with the prices charged for mediocre wine in NYC restaurants, or you can purchase a reasonably priced decent wine at the restaurant. We thoroughly enjoyed our selection and plan on going back.

ProviderLocation: 401 E 62nd St , New York City , NY 10065-7910 401 E 62nd St , New York City, NY 10065-7910
ReviewText: Our group of 6 used a groupon to eat here and we were really impressed; we would certainly go back without a discount coupon, as the food was good, reasonably priced and the service attentive. Among the highlights were wonderful bread and Mediterranean dips as starters and most of us had kebabs for out mains; every one of us expressed satisfaction with our entrees. It's a small place so make a reservation.

ProviderLocation: 401 E 62nd St , New York City , NY 10065-7910 401 E 62nd St , New York City, NY 10065-7910
ReviewText: Yesterday I happened to be in Downtown Manhattan around the time my wife finish worked. We ended up having a wonderful dinner at this restaurant. When we arrived, there was only one couple that we can see dining. But after we placed our order, more people have arrived and almost all the seats were taken. Place is tucked away hidden off 1st ave but easy enough to find. Metered 1 hour parking is available on 1st ave, first come first serve basis. The Starter was excellent. I ordered the cheese pie and my wife had the fried calamari. They both were delicious. I ordered the lamb adana and my wife ordered tiger shrimp sautee. Both were perfectly done to say the least. Very flavorful and delicious dishes plus it did not take long for the food to arrive on the table. We were served warm bread with olive oil to dip and that was a nice way to open any meal. We ended the dinner with Baklava which was wonderful as always. We purchased thru Groupon but they also have deal for 2 directly at the restaurant which includes a ticket for 2 at Dangerfield comedy club around the corner. We will be back again soon.

ProviderLocation: 401 E 62nd St , New York City , NY 10065-7910 401 E 62nd St , New York City, NY 10065-7910
ReviewText: Delicious food coupled with warm, welcoming, professional service makes this East side Mediterranean a winner. We loved all the dishes we tried - the portions were generous, the food was freshly prepared, tasty, and succulent. But what makes all the difference is the wonderful people who work at Anatolia. We were so lucky to be attended by Ceren and Anthony. A very lovely dining experience which we recommend wholeheartedly.

ProviderLocation: 401 E 62nd St , New York City , NY 10065-7910 401 E 62nd St , New York City, NY 10065-7910
ReviewText: We were staying up the block at the Bentley so this restaurant was perfectly located for us. The fabulous bread served with a dish of olive oil and olives started us off. The bread is incredible and made in house. We then shared the mixed cold appetizers (15.95) and one was better than the other. The yogurt dip was creamy with a perfect touch of tartness and composed of cucumbers, garlic, and mint. The home made stuffed grape leaves were delicious and very well flavored. We loved them. My husband does not ordinarily like babaganush but said this was the best he ever had, and I agree; it had a slight smoky flavor and a nice balance of garlic and tahini. Great hummus and a mixture of tomatoes, green and red peppers with onions and parsley dressed with oil and vinegar rounded out the platter. The only improvement would be to let everything come to room temperature before serving. At first it was a little too cold as it must have come straight from the fridge but as it warmed up the flavors really came alive. I realize the need for refrigeration but the cold temperature does take away from the unique and delicate seasoning of each dish. The appetizers were so filling that we split a main course of chicken adana and lamb kabob plate (18.95). The chicken was out of this world and the lamb was delicious as well but if we knew how really good that chicken was we would have ordered only that. You can have lamb anywhere but that ground chicken so perfectly seasoned is alone worth the trip to this restaurant. The dish came with a rice pilaf, grilled veggies and a salad. We were stuffed. The chef gave us a complimentary rice pudding, which was a very nice gesture and much appreciated. We never had Turkish wine before so we each ordered a glass of Yakut. It’s a nice dry, but non-acidic red that was very good and we are now on the hunt to find a few bottles. Overall we had a wonderful dinner and would definitely recommend this place. If you haven’t tried it yet and are thinking of it, stop thinking and just go there. Great food, great wine, and great service.

ProviderLocation: 401 E 62nd St , New York City , NY 10065-7910 401 E 62nd St , New York City, NY 10065-7910
ReviewText: The restaurant is small with limited seating. The decor is very basic, nothing special. The menu features Turkish and Middle Eastern dishes that are good but overpriced. The service is excellent. Very friendly and considerate staff. This appears to a neighborhood place.

ProviderLocation: 185 Bleecker St , New York City , NY 10012-1415 185 Bleecker St , New York City, NY 10012-1415
ReviewText: Just Horrible!!! We found chewed bread in our dish!! Overpriced menu for really poor quality and service! Worst experience in New York! Also worst experience in my life in a restaurant.. We were deceived from an " Italian " speaking waiter at the entrance. Inside the restaurant nobody was Italian ! Very rude and slow staff .. a real hell on earth !

ProviderLocation: 185 Bleecker St , New York City , NY 10012-1415 185 Bleecker St , New York City, NY 10012-1415
ReviewText: Very average white pasta, no garlic or any cream, just salty water base. Worst Caesar salad ever!! Just some dry lettuce and a few croutons, the cheese and dressing almost non existent. We tried it because it looked nice on a great corner, but food and service exceptionally poor, very disappointing considering the neighbourhood. Would not have tipped as much as the 18% if we had an option.

ProviderLocation: 185 Bleecker St , New York City , NY 10012-1415 185 Bleecker St , New York City, NY 10012-1415
ReviewText: Just stopped in here after dinner for drinks and it did not disappoint. Great ambiance! The Bellini and red sangria were amazing!

ProviderLocation: 185 Bleecker St , New York City , NY 10012-1415 185 Bleecker St , New York City, NY 10012-1415
ReviewText: Was looking to eat some good Italian food. Walked by this restaurant and decided to go back and eat here. What a great idea. Excellent service. Some of the best authentic Italian food I've had. Couldn't decide what I wanted to eat due to the choices on the menu. Wanted to eat almost everything. My girlfriend and I started with a mista. Really good choice. Then went with the antipasto platter. Another great choice. My girlfriend ordered the veal Saltimboca and I had the ravioli in a Bolognese sauce. She asked to have spaghetti with tomato sauce to replace the roast potatoes. No problem. The food we received is beyond what I expected and can't properly give it the proper kudos through typing. I then ordered the tiramisu for desert. OMG, some of the best tiramisu I've had. Definitely can't wait to go back and order the items that I couldn't taste.

ProviderLocation: 185 Bleecker St , New York City , NY 10012-1415 185 Bleecker St , New York City, NY 10012-1415
ReviewText: We strolled through little Italy and came upon Ciao, the man out the front explained the special very well and even offered us a glass of wine on the house. The Linguini special seafood was amazing, a lot of seafood which complimented the white wine based sauce excellently, did I say a lot of season, crab claw, half a langoustine, calamaris, good sized prawns (shrimp), 2 different bivalves, washed down with a nice pinot griggio and finished with a magnificent tiramsu, highly recommend, well priced and friendly people.

ProviderLocation: 171 Spring St , New York City , NY 10012-3843 171 Spring St , New York City, NY 10012-3843
ReviewText: first of all: book a table because otherwise it's quite impossible to eat before 11 p.m!! secondly: pick any appetizers, they are all delicious, reflecting the original Spanish tasting! thirdly: paella, paella and paella! it costs more than all the other dishes but it worth!!

ProviderLocation: 171 Spring St , New York City , NY 10012-3843 171 Spring St , New York City, NY 10012-3843
ReviewText: The food is great and we were really surprised. This restaurant seems to be a little bit expensive, but the food is delicious and the waiters are really kind and fast. We appreciated the location too: simple and elegant!!! Great place.

ProviderLocation: 171 Spring St , New York City , NY 10012-3843 171 Spring St , New York City, NY 10012-3843
ReviewText: We have been here several times while visiting New York. Friends found it first one night before heading to the Comedy Cellar an recommended it. What a gem! Cozy, romantic atmosphere, fabulous sangria, and amazing food! Share plates that are large enough fo a meal. Everything was delicious, fresh and screamed more! HIGHLY recommend for a wonderful evening out! Sit at the chefs counter if you can, you can watch the chefs prepare the food for an even more fun experience!

ProviderLocation: 171 Spring St , New York City , NY 10012-3843 171 Spring St , New York City, NY 10012-3843
ReviewText: Just love this place. Great food, wine, service and atmosphere. Its always full so its a great indicator of a great restaurant. Always looking forward to visiting this place. Have been here multiple times. Excellent food choices are the seafood paella, churros, pulpo and gambas. Always leaves me satisfied.

ProviderLocation: 171 Spring St , New York City , NY 10012-3843 171 Spring St , New York City, NY 10012-3843
ReviewText: This restaurant is great; buzzing atmosphere, excellent small portion tapas, good selection of drinks and a team that are efficient and friendly. The only down side is the space, it's tiny. If you are large or have a large party you will find the tables a nightmare! Great to find a Spanish beer on tap. Prices in line with the area. Good for couples or small groups.
