ProviderLocation: 171 Spring St , New York City , NY 10012-3843 171 Spring St , New York City, NY 10012-3843
ReviewText: Like most foodie destinations in New York, this place is authentically run by the same people who immigrated from the country that decorates the palate of this restaurant's offerings. I walked in on a Saturday afternoon, and saw the same crowd you normally find in the Hamptons, seated around two medium-sized tables in the back, just off the counter. Wine was flowing. Tapas was fully engaged. I took an egg and potato quiche, called a tortilla, from the deli counter, paid $4.25 but stuck around to take in the surroundings and the good vibes. Single folks sitting along the bar, eating tapas. Crowds in the back yelling and laughing. A full meat counter, stocked with Spanish goodies. And a full on paella on the brew, being dished out, sometimes for free, for curious onlookers. Check out this place. It's solid. Don't bring large groups. It's a small place. But definitely come alone or with a friend. You may meet someone and hit it off. It's just a really friendly atmosphere.
ReviewTitle: The Reason Your Friends Skip the Hamptons Each Weekend

ProviderLocation: 171 Spring St , New York City , NY 10012-3843 171 Spring St , New York City, NY 10012-3843
ReviewText: On business, looked up excellent value and taste. Boqueria Soho popped up. So glad I came in. Staff excellent! Food beyond excellent. I had garlic shrimp and lamb skewers. Bread for dipping! Both to die for. Tapas the way it should be. I wish I could try it all. I'll be back for sure. Great portions! Wine selection is awesome! Totally satisfied.
ReviewTitle: Pleasantly surprised! Or should I be?

ProviderLocation: 171 Spring St , New York City , NY 10012-3843 171 Spring St , New York City, NY 10012-3843
ReviewText: I recently went to this restaurant, in soho, and really liked the food. Very inventively served portions,i had the pate,and it was delicious.Not expensive, by new york standards. If you like good spanish food, this place is a must.

ProviderLocation: 171 Spring St , New York City , NY 10012-3843 171 Spring St , New York City, NY 10012-3843
ReviewText: I stumbled across this restaurant when walking down Spring St and am so glad that I walked in! Best tapas I've tasted in a long time - waitress was adorable and so helpful. Highly recommended!
ReviewTitle: Best meal I've had in New York!

ProviderLocation: 171 Spring St , New York City , NY 10012-3843 171 Spring St , New York City, NY 10012-3843
ReviewText: I was on my own in Soho and contemplating where to eat. I walked past this restaurant and noticed both the wonderful aromas and the buzz of atmosphere. Whilst tapas isn't generally something I'd consider on my own I thought the place looked really good. I was given a seat at a bar adjacent to the kitchen and it was like having your own show watching the chefs as they worked quickly and meticulously. A very pleasant way to spend time when dining on your own (although naturally most diners were part of larger groups). Good menu and the food was great!!
ReviewTitle: Great restaurant - whether solo or in groups

ProviderLocation: 350 East 53rd Street , New York City , NY 10022-5238 350 East 53rd Street , New York City, NY 10022-5238
ReviewText: Wonderful old-fashioned bar with reliable pub food. This type of "joint" becoming rarer and rarer. Very warm and cozy with delicious burgers and a variety of meat and fish entrees. Old-time favorites like chicken pot pie, fish and chips, liver and bacon. Even a sing-along on Wednesday nights. Parnell's is a perfect regular local hangout.

ProviderLocation: 350 East 53rd Street , New York City , NY 10022-5238 350 East 53rd Street , New York City, NY 10022-5238
ReviewText: Surprisingly good fare at a decent price in the very pricey Sutton Place neighborhood with a comfortable homey ambiance!
ReviewTitle: Good food at a fair price in Sutton Place

ProviderLocation: 350 East 53rd Street , New York City , NY 10022-5238 350 East 53rd Street , New York City, NY 10022-5238
ReviewText: This is a pub and restaurant with a lots of local people as guests. Went there for Thanksgiving dinner and the turkey was excellent. It is a very good Irish pub and restaurant, recommended.
ReviewTitle: Good for a drink and to grab something to eat.

ProviderLocation: 350 East 53rd Street , New York City , NY 10022-5238 350 East 53rd Street , New York City, NY 10022-5238
ReviewText: More than an Irish pub, with very good food. Chicken pot pie was excellent! A bit pricey, but what in Manhattan isn't?

ProviderLocation: 350 East 53rd Street , New York City , NY 10022-5238 350 East 53rd Street , New York City, NY 10022-5238
ReviewText: Every neighborhood has a place like Parnells, and Parnell's is ours. Perfectly adequate bangers and mash or burgers.

ProviderLocation: 350 East 53rd Street , New York City , NY 10022-5238 350 East 53rd Street , New York City, NY 10022-5238
ReviewText: You really have to judge Irish bars against this famous restaurant and bar combination. Very good food, excellent service, warm decor -- a feeling of home and close enough to midtown to be easy to drop in for a pint and a chat. The Irish did so much for New York City, and this place represents some of the very best of those contributions. I stopped by after a visit to Hunger Memorial on the Hudson River and thought long and hard about my trip to Ireland earlier this year.

ProviderLocation: 350 East 53rd Street , New York City , NY 10022-5238 350 East 53rd Street , New York City, NY 10022-5238
ReviewText: Two words: Tomato bisque. Delicious soup with a piece of grilled cheese. Loved it. Service was a bit slow since the place was packed. Live piano music. Fun place to stop by.

ProviderLocation: 350 East 53rd Street , New York City , NY 10022-5238 350 East 53rd Street , New York City, NY 10022-5238
ReviewText: Parnell's has reliably been good over the last 30 years. I know because I have been going there that long. The food is nicely done, and includes pistachio crusted cod with a buerre blanc sauce, liver bacon and onions, fish and chips (I substitute baked potato for the chips), and burgers. Servers are always young women with a range of ability from poor to great. If you can get Anna, you are lucky because she will notice if you raise your pinky in her direction. There are two comfortable rooms with ample space between tables. One room has the bar with a mature crowd of professional drinkers. Tables fill the remainder of the room. The back room has all tables, some on a platformed area. The atmosphere is faux Tiffany lamped, low lights and a good sound level, unless they are hosting a table of 10. The drinks are perfectly made. The prices have risen to a level that is a bit uncomfortable, but still tolerable. If you are in midtown east, Parnell's should be your default restaurant. Reservations never necessary.

ProviderLocation: 350 East 53rd Street , New York City , NY 10022-5238 350 East 53rd Street , New York City, NY 10022-5238
ReviewText: Saying "Irish Bar" in Midtown Manhattan is redundant. Most of the bars in that location Are Irish with the usual Bass and Guiness on tap--maybe Smithwick's. Parnell's at 53rd Street on First Avenue, however, is more than just the Irish brews and servers with a brogue. It offers excellent food at very reasonable prices. Its special-priced "Early Bird" dinner menu that runs from 5:30 -7PM on Monday-Thursday offers excellent value for money. It even comes with warm apple pie and vanilla ice cream as a dessert choice. The grilled salmon--always unmistakably fresh-- is always a winner. Those who like corned beef and cabbage can find it on the menu for St. Patrick's Day as well as a menu staple "out of season" on Thursdays. The corned beef is a slab of good meat, not a pile of shredded something-or-other passed off as the Irish favorite. Fish of other varieties and steak are also good choices here. The lovely eating area in the back offers quiet away from the sports bar in this popular neighborhood "local." In my experiences there, the food has always come promptly, served hot and from cheerful servers. I have taken out-of-town guests there and have recommended it to others. No one has yet to register a disappointment.

ProviderLocation: 350 East 53rd Street , New York City , NY 10022-5238 350 East 53rd Street , New York City, NY 10022-5238
ReviewText: Great music on Saturday night - fun crowd - Food mediocre at best - Service less than amiable

ProviderLocation: 829 W.181st , Washington heights , New York City , NY 829 W.181st , Washington heights , New York City, NY
ReviewText: The food is very mediocre. The service is ok. The hostess had a very bad attitude with every person that walked in. Not going back.

ProviderLocation: 829 W.181st , Washington heights , New York City , NY 829 W.181st , Washington heights , New York City, NY

I have never had bad food or bad wine here but if you want the real special treat...come on the weekend and oder the lasagna. They only make it on the weekend. I promise you won't be disappointed.

ProviderLocation: 829 W.181st , Washington heights , New York City , NY 829 W.181st , Washington heights , New York City, NY
ReviewText: The atmosphere is good, the food would have been good if it wasn't so salty. House wine was good. I wouldn't go here if I wasn't in the neighborhood. I might go back only because it's one of the better food options in this neighborhood. Not a destination restaurant.

ProviderLocation: 829 W.181st , Washington heights , New York City , NY 829 W.181st , Washington heights , New York City, NY
ReviewText: I’m going to go out on a limb, and say that Saggio is the best restaurant in the neighborhood – certainly the best I’ve discovered. It’s an intimate space which captures the feel and the flavors of a great trattoria-style restaurant. The menu is small, but includes a nice variety of options and periodically-changing specials; I often carb-splurge on one of their excellent housemade pasta dishes, but one can enjoy a completely satisfying meal without ingesting so much as a breadcrumb. Excellent salads and cold meat and cheese appetizer and antipasti options, and the rosemary roasted chicken and the grilled pork chop are both delicious if you’re not feeling like pasta. If pasta is on your menu, the black squid ink linguini is one of the best versions I’ve ever tasted, and the gnocchi are little mouth-pillows of delight. I can’t recommend the crostini highly enough; I would list our favorites, but that would include pretty much every option (okay, the wild mushroom and the liver pâté are both spectacular!). Delectable desserts; the poached pear with housemade fig gelato is heaven on a plate. Decent wines (glass wines can be uneven) and a well-equipped full bar; they also have daily happy hour specials (in the bar area only), which are delicious and extra affordable. The prices are surprisingly below New York standard, particularly for the quality of the food. We chanced upon Saggio the night we closed on our apartment nearby, and now often use it as a destination for special celebrations. In nearly two years of regular dining, it has never disappointed. Wait staff is friendly, helpful and accommodating; receptionists can seem unhappy to be alive, but the cloud of their attitude quickly dissipates once you’re seated.

ProviderLocation: 829 W.181st , Washington heights , New York City , NY 829 W.181st , Washington heights , New York City, NY
ReviewText: Came here for brunch and staff was very kind. Food was good. They allowed me to substitute something else in my sandwich easily. The only downfall was that it took long for it to come out, there were people around us getting unhappy. But it might've been an off day as the staff was very kind and apologetic anyway.

ProviderLocation: 829 W.181st , Washington heights , New York City , NY 829 W.181st , Washington heights , New York City, NY
ReviewText: i was staying in new york city for a few weeks on vacation and decided to visit saggio since i saw all the great ratings first let's start with the good, since there weren't too many. the ambience was very nice, the restaurant impeccably clean, and the music was great. the bad: where to start. first when entering the restaurant the hostess was actually sitting inside and not really greeting anyone, i wanted to sit on the bar and she was just on her phone. the service- i had the pleasure of being served by a bartender named Sarah, she was very nice and cordial, but made a few mistakes. i asked to order the penne from the menu and she said not to order the penne its a bad dish, now regardless if she was correct or not, in my opinion the biggest mistake a server can make is to say my decision is a bad one. so instead she offered i get the spaghetti off the specials menu. i agreed. the food came really fast, to my surprise, unfortunately the pasta was under cooked soaking in a bland tomato sauce and just a few crumbs of parmigiana cheese on top. you would expect an italian restaurant to at least be able to make the most classic italian dish. after i finished my dish Sarah didn't ask if i would like dessert or anything else, it seemed to me she just wanted to finish work and leave the wifi- for some reason when i asked Sarah for the password for the wifi she said she didnt know but didnt bother to ask anyone else so i could use the internet the worst part of sitting at the bar, it seems that when every worker finishes his shift at Saggio they sit at the bar for drinks and their meal..something that made a very uncomfortable time for me, sitting and listening to them complain about customers and other work related issues. bottom line, i would not recommend eating at Saggio except for the nice music
ReviewTitle: below average restaurant, not a place to go back to

ProviderLocation: 152 W 26th St , New York City , NY 10001-6975 152 W 26th St , New York City, NY 10001-6975
ReviewText: My wife and I enjoyed our visit to the RARE in the Hilton NY Fashion District Hotel in Chelsea. We started at the RARE View rooftop bar on 23rd floor and went back down for dinner. Great views of Uptown and casual environment at roof top bar. Back down to street level to enter restaurant at bar and surprisingly large and open dining room in hotel basement. Very friendly staff, food was good. My wife loved the lobster burger; I had the James Black Barrel burger, which was good, but I didn’t really taste any whiskey in the burger or slaw. Prices a little steep for an upscale burger joint but still worth checking out. Unique use of barbed wire graphics. We loved the environment and left stuffed, had to skip dessert for a walk in midtown.
ReviewTitle: Fun place in Chelsea to check out

ProviderLocation: 152 W 26th St , New York City , NY 10001-6975 152 W 26th St , New York City, NY 10001-6975
ReviewText: Had dinner on 1/11 at Rare. It's not much from the outside, connected to the Hilton Hotel. There is a bar connected to the restaurant which was crowded with happy hour guests, corporate crowd. The restaurant is a flight of steps down and is really nice. The service was fantastic. I wish I could remember our waiters name. The prices are reasonable for NYC too. We shared a salad which was excellent and the burgers were fantastic. The M&M burger was recommended and is excellent. You can tell the quality if meat and ingredients is top notch. I would highly recommend Rare to anyone in the area, it's perfect for a meal before an event at MSG.

ProviderLocation: 152 W 26th St , New York City , NY 10001-6975 152 W 26th St , New York City, NY 10001-6975
ReviewText: Nice quiet restaurant attached to hilton hotel at reasonable prices easy to get walk in table. Attentive staff and managment

ProviderLocation: 152 W 26th St , New York City , NY 10001-6975 152 W 26th St , New York City, NY 10001-6975
ReviewText: We did not eat in the restaurant at the ground floor, but had cocktails on the rooftop terrace. Great views, good service and nice cocktails (unfortunately served in plastic, not glass, I assume for safety reasons). If you go there for cocktails in the afternoon it can be crowdie, we went up at 5:30 PM and still had a nice seat, but later that would have been a challenge, as it was for other guests. Still, a great place to visit.
ReviewTitle: Great rooftop terrace with nice cocktails

ProviderLocation: 152 W 26th St , New York City , NY 10001-6975 152 W 26th St , New York City, NY 10001-6975
ReviewText: This place really is a gem. We even came back late night for the bar and some snacks. As far as appetizers go we got the Rueben frickle which is like corned beef and sauerkraut and pickles combined. Amazing. Entrees we got burgers. I got the M&M burger which is on their speciality menu of ones they marinate in different liquors. It was amazing and cooked perfectly to my taste. We also got the parmesan truffle fries and they are thin cut and were excellent as well. Overall, an awesome experience!!

ProviderLocation: 152 W 26th St , New York City , NY 10001-6975 152 W 26th St , New York City, NY 10001-6975
ReviewText: visited here while I was staying at the Hilton, and was pretty impressed. So often, hotel venues are an attempt at having a middle-of-the-road eatery with a captive resident audience, but this place is done very well indeed! It's a proper bar and grill, without feeling even remotely that it's part of a hotel. I had a la carte breakfast here while staying at the Hilton, as breakfast wasn't part of my package, and the selections were excellent and tasty. It's typical breakfast fare, but done with a touch of class that you'd expect of a restaurant that's a bar and grill. I also managed to check out the roof top bar, which was pretty cool. The views were good (though it was cloudy during my stay, so the view of the Empire State Building was pretty well hidden!), but the beer selection was a bit mundane, with just the usual mass-produced offerings available. Also, the rooftop bar only does snacks, not meals, so keep this in mind during your visit... Not a bad place at all
ReviewTitle: Nice place within the Hilton Fashion District Hotel

ProviderLocation: 152 W 26th St , New York City , NY 10001-6975 152 W 26th St , New York City, NY 10001-6975
ReviewText: Not only will you get good food but if you sit at the bar you will get a great drink and a fun bartender. Maurice is so funny and since I stay at the Hilton that is attached a few times a year; he even remembers me! You can't go wrong with either the bar downstairs or the fabulous rooftop bar upstairs.
ReviewTitle: great food and a fun bar

ProviderLocation: 152 W 26th St , New York City , NY 10001-6975 152 W 26th St , New York City, NY 10001-6975
ReviewText: It was about 20 mins to opening sat at the inside at the bar waiting for pre meal meeting to end . Hostess was nice asked if I wanted water I said I'd wait for the shift meeting to be over . Service bartender never acknowledged me he did break a few glasses while stocking . A manager stopped into tell him to be careful those glasses are expensive . I walked to the elevators after asking the bartender where they were located . There was an attendant he said the elevator was for the roof top only . I said yes that's where I would like to go . He said 5 more minutes so I took a seat other guests got on line he told them 2 mins . The hostess was super polite nice mustard colored outfit ! she inquired why I hadn't gone up stairs . I told her the gentleman was a bit rude so I'm charging my phone and I will be going up thank you . I'm dressed appropriately and don't understand why I was invisible to the bartender and dismissed by the elevator attendant . Hoping the experience upstairs makes up for the treatment in the lobby . Well the service was much better nice young lady pushing the elevator buttons . Bartender took my card & ID ... Cocktail waitress polite smiles red hair with curls and red lipstick she gave directions to a better view it was in the smoking section so I snapped a few picks and came back to the other side. Point is you should be nice to all your guests and staff ! that's how you make your living !! Bad day leave it at home . Bar manager a bit brash Sylvia was late and wants to leave she's dying . He wants her to leave because she was late again . He should have sent her home when she clocked in not berated her to the rest of the staff .
ReviewTitle: Just came in for a cocktail

ProviderLocation: 152 W 26th St , New York City , NY 10001-6975 152 W 26th St , New York City, NY 10001-6975
ReviewText: I went there because it was close to my hotel and I'm happy that I did! I started with the pickles wrapped in corn beef and fried. It was great get it. Then I had the filet steak which had a great peppercorn sauce. I substituted the mac and cheese for the fries best thing I had little beef pieces. I ate at the bar so great service.

ProviderLocation: 152 W 26th St , New York City , NY 10001-6975 152 W 26th St , New York City, NY 10001-6975
ReviewText: This place is a must if you're a guest at the Hilton New York Fashion District. Hilton HHonors Gold Members get a discount on the delicious breakfast buffet, and you get friendly service from David and Grigorio. The rooftop bar portion ("Rooftop Rare?") has to be seen to be fully appreciated, and up there you get great service from Lanny (who mixes Bombay Sapphire martinis just right), Abbie, and Robin. The hot wings are strong and delicious.

ProviderLocation: Broadway & 59th Street , New York City , NY 10019
ReviewText: Although this is a well known location not least from all the NYC police-based programmes it's difficult to get too worked up about it as an attraction in it's own right. There are more imposing builds in this city - though it is perhaps worth a look if you're passing by. It's almost co-location with Central Park is perhaps more relevant and beneficial.

ProviderLocation: Broadway & 59th Street , New York City , NY 10019
ReviewText: A good place to start your exploration of central park from. The Circle in itself if pretty and is well served by the metro.
ReviewTitle: A nice point to entre Central park from

ProviderLocation: Broadway & 59th Street , New York City , NY 10019
ReviewText: Either here or Bryant Park, they both have interesting items, but duplicates. Bryant Park seems to have more shops and food vendors.

ProviderLocation: Broadway & 59th Street , New York City , NY 10019
ReviewText: There are some really great shops at Columbus Circle under one roof and it has one of the many entrances to Central Park. Very nice Christmas Market at this time of the year and with the weather a cup of warm cider goes down well:

ProviderLocation: Broadway & 59th Street , New York City , NY 10019
ReviewText: We went there today and it was so busy but the buildings , Statue and globe sculpture was lovely and it is just off central Park and so easy to locate. Worth a visit while in the area and a lot of good looking places to eat just down the road

ProviderLocation: Broadway & 59th Street , New York City , NY 10019
ReviewText: I use to go to Whole Foods in basement level of Columbus Circle Mall there is a lot of gluten free and dairy free food I use to get. Also multivitamins for adults and kids and homeopathic remedies. This is the practical side when I visit the mall. Also I'm a fan of cosmetics and skin and hair care and parfumerie so I visit sephora in second floor and I merge in a dream world where I try diferentes brands and also I get samples. And I like to see fashion stores to see the new season tendencies. Nice experience.

ProviderLocation: Broadway & 59th Street , New York City , NY 10019
ReviewText: This, in my opinion, is not worth a taxi trip or even paid Subway ride to see. Not much there besides a few statues and street vendors.
ReviewTitle: If You've Seen Everything Else Check This Out

ProviderLocation: Broadway & 59th Street , New York City , NY 10019
ReviewText: Columbus Circle is not the Time Warner Shopping Center (some reviews are mixed up). While visiting in December, Columbus Circle hosts a variety of vendors stalls/tents for holiday shopping. Always a great area to walk about and explore.
ReviewTitle: Nice outdoor open area, south end of Central Park

ProviderLocation: Broadway & 59th Street , New York City , NY 10019
ReviewText: Want a free ( you should tip) drum concert? Are you a people watcher? Ample street food vendors, rent a bike , look at and photograph NY at it's best.
ReviewTitle: Early for an event Fantastic place to wait if weather cooperates

ProviderLocation: Broadway & 59th Street , New York City , NY 10019
ReviewText: Great for shopping, deserts, watching celebrities and museums, and of course an entry point to Central Park.
ReviewTitle: Has a nice artsy feel to it

ProviderLocation: 314 Bleecker St , Greenwich Village , New York City , NY 10014 314 Bleecker St , Greenwich Village , New York City, NY 10014
ReviewText: We had been to AOC once before for lunch, which was very good but not overly memorable. Our recent dinner, however, was excellent. From a lovely, freshly prepared steak tartare, to a fresh and carefully seasoned Dourade with sauce vierge, to a crazily lucious truffle mac & cheese, everything we ordered was very well executed. If you like simple, country French food (with a twist here and there) this is a great place for dinner with very fair prices.

ProviderLocation: 314 Bleecker St , Greenwich Village , New York City , NY 10014 314 Bleecker St , Greenwich Village , New York City, NY 10014
ReviewText: My wife found this place from Groupon and we decided to give it a try. It was far from our hotel so we took and cab but it was absolutely work the trek. Our waitress was straight out of France. I could sometimes hardly understand her but she was very good. We ordered the salmon carpaccio, I've personally never seen that item before so we tried it. Very fresh salmon, sliced thin with a lemon wedge. Stunning. I ordered a pork-chop and my wife got the hanger steak. My pork-chop was absolute delicious but hands down that hanger steak won. So tender and juicy, the sauce was delicious. If I had cooked that at home I would have been licking the plate afterwards. Highly recommend, even without the Groupon it was still fairly priced and I would absolutely repeat eating here.

ProviderLocation: 314 Bleecker St , Greenwich Village , New York City , NY 10014 314 Bleecker St , Greenwich Village , New York City, NY 10014
ReviewText: The food is amazing! The music is fantastic! This quaint little French bistro was very enjoyable and the service was great too.

ProviderLocation: 314 Bleecker St , Greenwich Village , New York City , NY 10014 314 Bleecker St , Greenwich Village , New York City, NY 10014
ReviewText: Nice atmosphere, good (not great) food, large portions - but frozen chips! Our third visit and it would have garnered a four star review had it not been for the sad end to the evening. I added 15% tip - and was told that it wasn't enough! I'm personally tired of the way that large tips are expected - hey! It is a tip! A discretionary recognition by the customer. I was shocked by the semi aggressive manner - and here is my 'tip' - being rude brings bad reviews and no return visit.
ReviewTitle: They tell you what to tip!

ProviderLocation: 314 Bleecker St , Greenwich Village , New York City , NY 10014 314 Bleecker St , Greenwich Village , New York City, NY 10014
ReviewText: The menu looked promising, the setting was quiet and French, but the service was slow and aloof. We ordered simply a croque madam and Monsieur. When it finally came 30 min later, the fries were wilted and the sandwiches tepid warm. It clearly had been left under the heat lamps and forgotten. I can see how the food could be good there, but poor service just wrecks the whole experience.

ProviderLocation: 314 Bleecker St , Greenwich Village , New York City , NY 10014 314 Bleecker St , Greenwich Village , New York City, NY 10014
ReviewText: I have been frequenting AOC for a few years now and love to go there every other Tuesday for Gypsy Jazz guitarist (he is amazing - very talented), a big steaming bowl of Mussels Mariniere and a glass of Sancerre. Some chit-chat with the always-nice-folks at the bar, and all that is a match made in heaven. Strongly recommend this for business travelers wanting to unwind and tourists wanting a nice West Village experience at a reasonable price.

ProviderLocation: 314 Bleecker St , Greenwich Village , New York City , NY 10014 314 Bleecker St , Greenwich Village , New York City, NY 10014
ReviewText: I had brunch here in November 2016 and it was really good! Had omelette, which was delicious! it was quiet, full of locals - what else do you need in NYC?

ProviderLocation: 314 Bleecker St , Greenwich Village , New York City , NY 10014 314 Bleecker St , Greenwich Village , New York City, NY 10014
ReviewText: I found this charming restaurant thru United Miles. It is a nice corner bistro with an unpretentious vibe. I had a nice table up front where I could watch the street. Of course Bleeker never fails to amuse. The food and service are beyond reproach. I had a Confit de Canard with foie gras to start. And a couple of glasses of a nice Cote du Rhone to mellow things out. A lovely evening. Highly recommended.

ProviderLocation: 314 Bleecker St , Greenwich Village , New York City , NY 10014 314 Bleecker St , Greenwich Village , New York City, NY 10014
ReviewText: Passed by this place in my wanderings in the Village. always noticed the oysters for a buck. Finally stopped in for lunch on a Saturday. Sat at the bar for the buck oysters (Long Island Blue Points). It was a lively place and packed. Seems like a neighborhood vibe. Oysters were perfect and the beer was cold. great lunch. the rest of the menu seemed interesting and fairly priced. would go back to try other offerings and of course the oysters.

ProviderLocation: 314 Bleecker St , Greenwich Village , New York City , NY 10014 314 Bleecker St , Greenwich Village , New York City, NY 10014
ReviewText: I live 2 blocks away and have been coming to AOC once a week for several months now. I can honestly say I have never had a bad experience at this restaurant. The food is authentic French, served promptly and consistently great quality. Alessandro is typically my server as I usually go on Saturday for lunch and he always does an amazing job. The bus people, hostess, owner and servers are always friendly and attentive. I have had the frisee au lardon salad, merquez sandwich, steak tartare (this is my regular order, always top quality), cheese plate and croustillant de chèvre to name a few and all were of comparable or better quality to what I have had in France. I will continue to frequent AOC weekly as long as I live in the neighborhood and next time, I promise to post photos of the amazing food I have...I always forget to take pictures before I start eating!

ProviderLocation: 143 Christopher St , New York City , NY 10014 143 Christopher St , New York City, NY 10014
ReviewText: I've been going to Gaetana's for over 10 years now. It is a nice little place in the West Village. The food is excellent and the service is friendly. The prices are not high either. It has an old time bar the travels almost the length of the restaurant. If you like Frank Sin. Music then this place is for you. Step back in time and enjoy your meal.
ReviewTitle: Nice restaturant in the West Village

ProviderLocation: 143 Christopher St , New York City , NY 10014 143 Christopher St , New York City, NY 10014
ReviewText: You see the restaurant and think should I try this? You will be sorry if you do not! The food is excellent. The place is clean. The waitress was friendly and professional. She was knowledgeable about the food and preparation. There were 4 of us. Entrees included Shrimp Scampi and homemade lasagna (I ate my shrimp scampi and half of wife's Lasagna). The shrimps were huge! Fresh made lasagna was out of this world delicious! They treat you special. If you watch closely, everyone that comes in is greeted with a smile. Wish I lived closer...would be a weekly excursion!!
ReviewTitle: Bringing back the the awesome New York Neighborhood place to eat!!

ProviderLocation: 143 Christopher St , New York City , NY 10014 143 Christopher St , New York City, NY 10014
ReviewText: Wonderful atmosphere created by staff and ownership, very good food & service, makes you feel as if your with good friends or family. Well worth it, all good here...
ReviewTitle: Great food & service, your welcome like family...

ProviderLocation: 143 Christopher St , New York City , NY 10014 143 Christopher St , New York City, NY 10014
ReviewText: On the plus side the staff here are really friendly and welcoming ... and the restaurant has a lovely ambience. However, the food is disappointing, at least the choices we made on the night we visited were, that is. I had the clam linguine and my partner had the rigatoni arrabiata. The clam dish was bland and the arrabiata was just offensively hot - so hot that there was no flavour, just heat (and we're no strangers to fiery chilli-hot dishes). Such a shame ...
ReviewTitle: Great atmosphere and staff - not so, the food

ProviderLocation: 143 Christopher St , New York City , NY 10014 143 Christopher St , New York City, NY 10014
ReviewText: Went to west village to check out restaurants and came upon Gaetana's. Liked the looks of the menu, the ambiance and the size of the crowd. Good vibes, so we stayed for dinner and met Michelle and Frankie, the owners. Excellent food, great service, good conversations in a very welcoming environment. We were so pleased, that we are coming back to celebrate our daughters 16th birthday in two weeks, along with 15 of her friends. Frankie was very accommodating on this point.

ProviderLocation: 143 Christopher St , New York City , NY 10014 143 Christopher St , New York City, NY 10014
ReviewText: Was heading to Jersey City and looking for an alternative to the Jersey City/Newport restaurants and stumbled on this neighborhood restaurant a half block from the Christopher St. PATH station. Seemed to be several regulars at the bar speaking with the owner/manager. The bar has one flatscreen TV and is separated from the main restaurant area by a partial wall, lined with high top tables and a couple rows of regular height tables - was nicely done. Exposed brick walls, wood or tin tiled ceiling, mosaic tiled floor - décor was nostalgic. Music was Sinatra with some holiday music mixed in. Service very attentive, the owner manager came by at least twice. Several daily specials. Huge portions. Nice bread and olive oil brought to table. Really nice find.

ProviderLocation: 143 Christopher St , New York City , NY 10014 143 Christopher St , New York City, NY 10014
ReviewText: Had only a little bit of time before going to the Lucille Lortel Theatre to see Lost Girls, and found Gaetana's. Went in for a Campari and soda, but suddenly became hungry after seeing and smelling the dishes being served around me. Cozy atmosphere, friendly bartender Lisa, and delicious food. Frank the owner was terrific; he introduced himself and the bartender, and after realizing I was pressed for time, made sure I got what I ordered in a flash. The food was delicious (lentil soup, house-made focaccia, and a glass of chianti) and the vibe so comfortable and friendly, I didn't want to leave, but had to. Can't wait to go back!

ProviderLocation: 143 Christopher St , New York City , NY 10014 143 Christopher St , New York City, NY 10014
ReviewText: The only reason I visited this restaurant is the PATH service was suspended and I simply wanted to eat and drink while I waited (the restaurant is one block from the Christopher Street PATH station). I sat at the bar, which had both the preseason Giants and Jets game on the two TVs. I felt like the bartender was more interested in the games than me. Also it seems like a locals place since the tables were buzzing at 6PM on this Saturday. I will say that my linguine with white clam sauce was quite good - lotsa little, littlenecks and al dente linguine and the fact that 3 clams weren't opened didn't matter as there were 15 others (although can't the kitchen notice unopened clams?). My bad for ordering the "Pinot" and receiving a Pinot Grigio. The bartender's bad for not clarifying noir vs. Grigio. He happily replaced the wine and the pour was generous and the wine quite nice. I returned the dry, hard bread before my pasta arrived as even dipping it in the olive oil provided didn't help and was told fresh bread was being baked. After asking again for bread before I was finished with my pasta it arrived and was much better than what I was first served. There are numerous Frank Sinatra pictures on the walls and it seems a friendly enough place - although I wondered why there was an ATM machine in the entrance if they accept credit cards. Just an average Italian joint to me.

ProviderLocation: 143 Christopher St , New York City , NY 10014 143 Christopher St , New York City, NY 10014
ReviewText: I returned to Gaetana's after nine months and ordered the Lasagna. It was just a good as my last visit. This time I had lentil soup that was the size of a meal all by itself. Unfortunately, it was too salty and I had only a few spoonfuls :-( Hopefully this was one off.

ProviderLocation: 143 Christopher St , New York City , NY 10014 143 Christopher St , New York City, NY 10014
ReviewText: Was quite late on a Saturday evening, and I just wandered in with fingers crossed. I was seated promptly and ordered the home made lasagna and a glass of wine. It was delicious. Service was attentive, the premises were clean, and prices reasonable for NYC. I would not hesitate to return.

ProviderLocation: 373 W 46th St , New York City , NY 10036-3810 373 W 46th St , New York City, NY 10036-3810
ReviewText: Very small space, but for 2 it was perfect! Cool atmosphere and history...found this via a google/trip advisor search and so glad we tried it! The salad with goat cheese and cranberries was delicious, also the lobster ravioli--so good! Great for a casual dinner--we had no wait at all on a Saturday night.

ProviderLocation: 373 W 46th St , New York City , NY 10036-3810 373 W 46th St , New York City, NY 10036-3810
ReviewText: Since we were seeing a Sunday off Broadway matinee we decided to go for brunch in midtown NYC. Chose Hourglass as it had a good write up and more stars than others. First, since it is a renovated 3 story (tiny) brownstone, we could have been asked to go upstairs. But because I am using a cane due to hip problems, the owner, Beth, was extremely accommodating in asking some young gents who had just sat down if they would mind going upstairs which they did. She also made the downstairs employee restroom available to me. The brunch choices were excellent and all 4 of us were very happy. 2 of us had the Mexican omelet w 3 cheeses and a spicy green topping, the sword fish was a beautiful platter and the Caesar salad had an enormous amount of add-on grilled chicken. But the bloody Mary's were to die for with added horse radish and a hot pepper & olives garnish. (Though the olives should not have had pits). The story behind the name is that the hourglasses on the walls were turned when you began drinking at the Tavern in days gone by and when your time was up, you had to leave. The true testament of its excellent quality was that the prior owner & his wife came in to eat, even after 8 years. Try it, you'll like it as much as we did!

ProviderLocation: 373 W 46th St , New York City , NY 10036-3810 373 W 46th St , New York City, NY 10036-3810
ReviewText: Great steak. Classic American NYC cuisine. Good and friendly service . Unique and intimate. Good value for money

ProviderLocation: 373 W 46th St , New York City , NY 10036-3810 373 W 46th St , New York City, NY 10036-3810
ReviewText: The service is really quite good and the prices are reasonable for Manhattan...especially in the Theater district...The menu does offer some Prix Fix choices that include salad, "double butter" mashed potatoes, very good sauteed spinach or broccoli ... and desert..the desert choices were Tiramisu or a cobbler of apple and blueberries....the tiramisu was not particularly very good...not terrible, but not as good as I thought it would be, based on how good the meals were. The cobbler was pretty good. There were 6 of us and we tried different things from others' plates, and everyone agreed that all the meals were quite good and ample sized portions. Again, the service was really good...they do know that people want to eat and get to the theater and they accomplish it without making you feel rushed.
ReviewTitle: Great place to eat before catching a Broadway Show

ProviderLocation: 373 W 46th St , New York City , NY 10036-3810 373 W 46th St , New York City, NY 10036-3810
ReviewText: We ate here before seeing Hamilton last week. The reviews were very accurate. It is a cute restaurant with very nice service, very reasonable prices and good, if not exciting food. The pre theatre menu is a bargain and the wait staff was efficient to get you out on time without seeming rushed. Will definitely go back,

ProviderLocation: 373 W 46th St , New York City , NY 10036-3810 373 W 46th St , New York City, NY 10036-3810
ReviewText: A wonderful place to eat & have a few drinks. Staff is excellent and so is the food. This place has three floor each with it's own unique ambiance. The owner makes it her business to greet the customers. My favorite place of all time.

ProviderLocation: 373 W 46th St , New York City , NY 10036-3810 373 W 46th St , New York City, NY 10036-3810
ReviewText: I have eaten at the The Hourglass Tavern twice in the past year. The first time I was seated on the 1st floor and the the second time I had the pleasure of seating on the 3rd floor. It was a different dinning experience on the 3rd floor because it was quieter and more comfortable. But both experiences were positive. Good food, good service and decent prices. This will be my go to place when I am in town for a show.

ProviderLocation: 373 W 46th St , New York City , NY 10036-3810 373 W 46th St , New York City, NY 10036-3810
ReviewText: Based on all the great reviews I was expecting this place to be wonderful. I liked the decor & feel of the place (I ate on the ground floor), the staff were friendly & efficient, the prices were reasonable but the food was only OK. I don't think I'll be hurrying back.

ProviderLocation: 373 W 46th St , New York City , NY 10036-3810 373 W 46th St , New York City, NY 10036-3810
ReviewText: Packed for a Saturday night pre-theater crowd, although I had to wait for my reserved table, they got me to the show on time. In fact, the service was terrific. The portions are generous, and the food straightforward. (While the steamed broccoli was fresh it was completely unseasoned.) The best surprise for me was the variety and quality of wines by the glass at exceptionally reasonable prices for New York. It's not fancy but you'll be well fed.

ProviderLocation: 373 W 46th St , New York City , NY 10036-3810 373 W 46th St , New York City, NY 10036-3810
ReviewText: Been going to this restaurant since 2002, but this was my first time back since the new ownership took over. It was also my last time back since the new ownership took over. Everything that I loved about this place is now completely gone from the great welcome you would always receive upon walking in to the myriad of choices for the pre-theater prix fixe menu. The options were now down to about 5 choices, and most of them did not sound too appetizing. I was also read a list of four specials which I mistakenly believed to be part of that menu but later on, found out they were not(Definitely my fault for assuming), but it's pretty bad when one of the specials was already gone at 6:00(Especially since it was the one I wanted to order).What I did have, the rack of lamb, was ordinary at best along with bland mashed potatoes and tasteless broccoli and then to top it all off, the restaurant's specialty dessert, the famous chocolate mouse was nowhere to be seen on the menu. The personal touches and friendly service that I always so looked forward to appear to be long gone as well. I guess like they say, nothing lasts forever, and I will always have my fond memories of what a great place this used to be. The good news is, it's not hard to find another really good restaurant in New York City.

ProviderLocation: 118 10th Ave , New York City , NY 10011 118 10th Ave , New York City, NY 10011
ReviewText: My husband and I were on 10th Avenue, very near one of the High Line entrances. We were looking for a place for Sunday brunch, and saw The Park. The menu looked good for brunch-- not a huge selection, but with some unusual offerings-- and with moderate prices. We sat in the main dining room (high ceilings, skylights, huge windows, but you can also opt for the Garden Room (lots of plants, even birds calling). I had poached eggs with salmon hash (figured I'd give it a try), and Bob had eggs with cheese polenta and pancetta. Our great, friendly, smiling server (Elba) started us off with 2 slices of banana bread and very good coffee. Both entrees were excellent. There was soft music in the background, and the wide open and tall space encouraged us to sit and talk for longer than we might otherwise have. It's a place that we will take out of town visitors, and return to ourselves, maybe for dinner.
ReviewTitle: Visiting the High Line?? This is steps away...

ProviderLocation: 118 10th Ave , New York City , NY 10011 118 10th Ave , New York City, NY 10011
ReviewText: Interior of the Park is really cool. Live trees, glass ceiling, fire place area for drinks. Food was underwhelming- cheese board only had 4 small pieces of cheese and the rest was apples, walnut pieces, crasins, and pears. Most likely would not return

ProviderLocation: 118 10th Ave , New York City , NY 10011 118 10th Ave , New York City, NY 10011
ReviewText: This restaurant located near High Line Park is absolutely amazing. It has five unique spaces - The Atrium, Main Room, Red Room, Penthouse and Garden. Each room as a unique vibe that is so cool. We ate brunch out in the Garden with huge trees lit like a magical forest, cute little birds flying around (although on left an unfortunate gift on my husband's jacket), wonderfully relaxing music and excellent wait staff. I would highly recommend visiting this NYC treasure at least once.

ProviderLocation: 118 10th Ave , New York City , NY 10011 118 10th Ave , New York City, NY 10011
ReviewText: We stopped here after dinner to grab a drink. It wasn't too crowded. They have a fireplace and good drink selection.

ProviderLocation: 118 10th Ave , New York City , NY 10011 118 10th Ave , New York City, NY 10011
ReviewText: Met as a large family group of 11 for brunch, lovely menu, great food, friendly service, would definitely return when visiting NY again.

ProviderLocation: 118 10th Ave , New York City , NY 10011 118 10th Ave , New York City, NY 10011
ReviewText: After a walk along the High Line and a stroll round Chelsea Market, I had lunch at The Park. It was recommended by friends who live in New Jersey. I was presented with a good port of delicious focaccia and olive oil. I rather expected to see a charge for this on the bill but it was complimentary. The salad nicoise used fresh tuna, perfectly seared and presented with a soft boiled egg. It was delicious. I also enjoyed a pint of Brooklyn lager, a craft beer. All this was around $25 which is good value in New York. The restaurant is large and airy, so much better than the dark and poky places in Chelsea Market.

ProviderLocation: 118 10th Ave , New York City , NY 10011 118 10th Ave , New York City, NY 10011
ReviewText: Bigger than many NYC restaurants, people who work there were all very lovely. Nice size bar area, as well as large restaurant areas. Nice atmosphere, not gourmet, not outstanding.
